column1: agnau hutvā nityavacca devaṃ samprārthayennamet /
column2: Having offered unto the fire as done everyday one should pray to the deity and bow down.

column1: samarpya karma devāya pūjāṃ naimittikīṃ caret //
column2: Having submitted one’s actions to the deity one should perform the naimittika periodical ceremony.

column1: dvārapālaviṣṇukumbhavardhanīḥ prārthayeddhariṃ /
column2: One should worship the gatekeeper, the pitcher ofViṣṇu and the varddhanī vessel and Hari.

column1: ato deveti mantreṇa mūlamantreṇa kumbhake //
column2: The pitcher should be consecrated with the sacred syllable ‘ato deva’ and the following.

column1: kṛṣṇa kṛṣṇa namastubhyaṃ gṛhṇīṣvedaṃ pavitrakaṃ /
column2: “O Kṛṣṇa! Salutations to you.

column1: pavitrīkaraṇārthāya varṣapūjāphalapradaṃ //
column2: You accept this sacred thread for the sake of purifying all and which yields fruits of a year’s worship.

column1: pavitrakaṃ kurudhvādya yanmayā duṣkṛtaṃ kṛtaṃ /
column2: You purify sins that had been committed by me.

column1: śuddho bhavāmyahaṃ deva tvatprasādāt sureśvara //
column2: O God! the lord of celestials will be purified by your grace.”

column1: pavitrañca hṛdādyaistu ātmānamabhiṣicya ca / viṣṇukumbhañca samprokṣya vrajeddevasamīpataḥ //
column2: Having sprinkled mentally the sacred thread and the self, and having sprinkled the pitcher of Viṣṇu, one should go near the deity.

column1: pavitramātmane dadyādrakṣābandhaṃ visṛjya ca /
column2: One should offer a sacred thread to the self, after having discarded the protective thread tied on the hand.

column1: gṛhāṇa brahmasūtrañca yanmayā kalpitaṃ prabho // karmaṇāṃ pūraṇārthāya yathā doṣo na me bhavet /
column2: O Lord! Accept the sacred thread that has been made ready by me, for the sake of accomplishing rites so that there may not be any fault on me.

column1: dvārapālāsanagurumukhyānāñca pavitrakam // kaniṣṭādi ca devāya vanamālāñca mūlataḥ / hṛdādiviśvaksenānte pavitrāṇi samarpayet //
column2: The sacred thread should be offered to the gatekeepers, the seat and to the chief preceptors. The garlands of forest flowers should be offered to the gods of inferior order with the basic formula. The articles should be offered to the heart etc.

column1: vahnau hutvāgnivartibhyo viṣṇvādibhyaḥ pavitrakam / prārcya pūrṇāhutiṃ dadyāt prāyaścittāya mūlataḥ //
column2: and ending with Viṣvaksena an epithet of Viṣṇu. Having offered to the fire the oblations placed near the fire for Viṣṇu and other gods, and having worshipped, the final oblation should then be made with the basic formula for the expiation of one’s sins.

column1: aṣṭottaraśataṃ vāpi pañcopaniṣadaistataḥ / maṇividrumamālābhirmandārakusumādibhiḥ // iyaṃ sāṃvatsarī pūjā tavāstu garuḍadhvaja /
column2: O Lord! having Garuḍa as your emblem! Let this be your annual adoration with one hundred and eight or five Upaniṣads and with garlands of gems and corals, the flowers mandāra and others.

column1: vanamālā yathā deva kaustubhaṃ satataṃ hṛdi // tadvat pavitratantūṃś ca pūjāṃ ca hṛdaye vaha /
column2: “O Lord! Just as the garland of wild flowers and the kaustubha gem are worn always on the chest, so also bear the sacred thread and the worship on the chest.

column1: kāmato 'kāmato vāpi yatkṛtaṃ niyamārcane // vidhinā vighnalopena paripūrṇaṃ tadastu me / prārthya natvā kṣamāpyātha pavitraṃ mastake 'rpayet //
column2: Whatever has been done wantonly or unwantonly in the regulations of the worship let it become complete by the rite shorn of impediments.” Having worshipped, bowing down, and requesting them the purified article should be placed on one’s own head.

column1: datvā baliṃ dakṣiṇābhirvaiṣṇavantoṣayedguruṃ /
column2: Having made offering to Viṣṇu the preceptor should be satisfied by giving the fees.

column1: viprān bhojanavastrādyair divasaṃ pakṣameva vā //
column2: The brahmins should be satisfied by giving food, clothes and other things either for a day or for a fortnight.

column1: pavitraṃ snānakāle ca avatārya samarpayet /
column2: At the time of bathing, having gone down into the waters, the sacred thread should be offered.

column1: anivāritamannādyaṃ dadyādbhuṅktetha ca svayaṃ //
column2: Without any restriction, food and other things should be given to others and then one has to eat.

column1: visarjane 'hni sampūjya pavitrāṇi visarjayet /
column2: Having worshipped fire at the rite of dismissal the threads are removed.

column1: sāṃvatsarīmimāṃ pūjāṃ sampādya vidhivanmama // vraja pavitrakedānīṃ viṣṇulokaṃ visarjitaḥ /
column2: One should then say “Having thus duly accomplished my annual adoration O thread! you now go to the world of Viṣṇu having been permitted by me.

column1: madhye someśayoḥ prārcya viṣvaksenaṃ hi tasya ca // pavitrāṇi samabhyarcya brāhmaṇāya samarpayet /
column2: Having worshipped Someśa and Viṣvaksena at the centre and having worshipped the sacred threads one should dedicate them to thebrahmins.

column1: yāvantastantavastasmin pavitre parikalpitāḥ // tāvadyugasahasrāṇi viṣṇuloke mahīyate /
column2: As many knots as there are in that thread one will live gloriously for so many thousands of years in the world of Viṣṇu.

column1: kulānāṃ śatamuddhṛtya daśa pūrvān daśāparān / viṣṇulokaṃ tu saṃsthāpya svayaṃ muktimavāpnuyāt //
column2: One will get release from bondage after having redeemed hundreds of his ancestors the ten preceding and the ten succeeding and having established them in the world of Viṣṇu.

column1: saṅkṣepāt sarvadevānāṃ pavitrārohaṇaṃ śṛṇu /
column2: Listen to the description of the mode of investiture for all deities.

column1: pavitra sarvalakṣma syāt svarasānalagaṃ tvapi //
column2: The thread is the primary characteristic as. well as its yellow orpiment.

column1: jagadyone samāgaccha parivāragaṇaiḥ saha /
column2: O the cause of the universe! come here along witḥ the attendant gods.

column1: nimantrayāmyahaṃ prātardadyāntubhyaṃ pavitrakaṃ ///
column2: invite you in the morning and offer this sacred thread.

column1: jagatsṛje namastubhyaṃ gṛhṇīṣvedaṃ pavitrakaṃ /
column2: O the creator of the universe.

column1: pavitrīkaraṇārthāya varṣapūjāphalapradaṃ // śivadeva namastubhyaṃ gṛhṇīṣvedaṃ pavitrakaṃ / maṇividrumamālābhirmandārakusumādibhiḥ //
column2: Salutations to you! Accept this sacred thread for the sake of purification and which conveys the fruits of the annual worship. O God Śiva! Salutations to you! Accept this sacred thread along with garlands of gems and corals and mandāra flowers.

column1: iyaṃ sāṃvatsarī pūjā tavāstu vedavitpate /
column2: O lord of the learned in the Vedas! Let this be your annual worship.

column1: sāṃvatsarīmimāṃ pūjāṃ sampādya vidhimanmama // vraja pavitrakedānīṃ svargalokaṃ visarjitaḥ /
column2: After having accomplished this annual worship of mine according to the rules, O articles of worship! go to heavens after being discarded by me.

column1: sūryadeva namastubhyaṃ gṛhṇīṣvedaṃ pavitrakaṃ //
column2: O lord Sun! Salutations to you.

column1: śivadeva namastubhyaṃ gṛhṇīṣvedaṃ pavitrakaṃ //
column2: Accept this article of worship. O Lord Śiva! Salutations to you.

column1: pavitrīkaraṇārthāya varṣapūjāphalapradaṃ /
column2: Accept this article of worship which is capable of yielding fruits of annual worship for the sake of purification.

column1: vāṇeśvara namastubhyaṃ gṛhṇīṣvedaṃ pavitrakaṃ //
column2: O lord of gaṇas! Salutations to you.

column1: pavitrīkaraṇārthāya varṣapūjāphalapradaṃ /
column2: Accept this article of worship which is capable of yielding fruits of anual worship for the sake of purification.

column1: śaktideva namastubhyaṃ gṛhṇīṣvedaṃ pavitrakaṃ //
column2: O goddess Śakti! Salutations to you.

column1: pavitrīkaraṇārthāya varṣapūjāphalapradaṃ /
column2: Accept this.article of worship which is capable of yielding fruits of annual worship for the sake of purification.

column1: nārāyaṇamayaṃ sūtramaniruddhamayaṃ varaṃ // dhanadhānyāyurārogyapradaṃ sampradadāmi te /
column2: dedicate unto you this excellent thread verily the same as lord Nārāyaṇa and lord Aniruddha and which is capable of yielding fruits of annual worship for the sake of purification and which yields wealth, grains and health.

column1: kāmadevamayaṃ sūtraṃ saṅkarṣaṇamayaṃ varaṃ // vidyāsantatisaubhāgyapradaṃ sampradadāmi te /
column2: dedicate unto you this excellent thread verily the same as Kāmadeva and Saṅkarṣaṇa, which yields learning, progeny and welfare.

column1: vāsudevamayaṃ sūtraṃ dharmakāmārthamokṣadaṃ // saṃsārasāgarottārakāraṇaṃ pradadāmi te /
column2: dedicate unto you this thread verily the same as Vāsudeva, which yields dharma, artha, kāma, and mokṣa and which is the cause for transport over the ocean of mundane existence.

column1: viśvarūpamayaṃ sūtraṃ sarvadaṃ pāpanāśanaṃ // atītānāgatakulasamuddhāraṃ dadāmi te /
column2: This thread verily the universal form is the donor of all things, the destroyer of sins and elevates past and future lineage.

column1: kaniṣṭhādīni catvāri manubhistu kramāddade //
column2: offer in order to the four younger deities with the mystic syllables.

column1: vāsudevādyālayasya kṛtau vakṣye phalādikaṃ /
column2: wil now describe the benefits of erecting the temples of Vāsudeva and others.

column1: cikīrṣordevadhāmādi sahasrajanipāpanut // manasā sadmakartṝṇāṃ śatajanmāghanāśanaṃ /
column2: One who is desirous of constructing the temples of gods gets freed from sins incurred in thousand births. Those who conceive of building a temple get the sins accrued in hundreds of births destroyed.

column1: yenumodanti kṛṣṇasya kriyamāṇaṃ narā gṛhaṃ // tepi pāpair vinirmuktāḥ prayāntyacyutalokatāṃ /
column2: Those who approve the building of a temple for lord Kṛṣṇa, also become free from their sins and go to the world of Acyuta Viṣṇu.

column1: samatītaṃ bhaviṣyañca kulānāmayutaṃ naraḥ // viṣṇulokaṃ nayatyāśu kārayitvā harergṛhaṃ /
column2: Having built a temple for Hari, a man immediately conveys a lakh of his ancestors both past and future to the world of Viṣṇu.

column1: vasanti pitaro dṛṣṭvā viṣṇuloke hy alaṅkṛtāḥ // vimuktā nārakair duḥkhaiḥ kartuḥ kṛṣṇasya mandiraṃ /
column2: The manes of a person who builds a temple for Viṣṇu having seen it remain in the world of Viṣṇu wellhonoured and relieved of their sufferings in hells.

column1: brahmahatyādipāpaughaghātakaṃ devatālayaṃ //
column2: The erection of the abode for the deity destroys sins such as the killing of a brahmin.

column1: phalaṃ yannāpyate yajñair dhāma kṛtvā tadāpyate / devāgāre kṛte sarvatīrthasnānaphalaṃ labhet //
column2: Whichever benefit could not be obtained by doing sacrificial rites, could be got by the erection of an abode for the god. He who erects an abode for the god reaps fruits of bathing in all holy waters.

column1: devādyarthe hatānāñca raṇe yattatphalādikaṃ / śāṭhyena pāṃśunā vāpi kṛtaṃ dhāma ca nākadaṃ //
column2: Even the making of a temple by perfidy with dust one would reach heaven. It gets more benefits than those got being slain in the battle.

column1: ekāyatanakṛt svargī tryagārī brahmalokabhāk /
column2: One who builds one temple goes to heaven. One who builds three temples goes to the world of Brahmā.

column1: pañcāgārī śambhulokamaṣṭāgārāddharau sthitiḥ //
column2: The builder of five abodes reaches the world of Śambhu Śiva. By building eight abodes one remains in the world of Hari.

column1: ṣoḍaśālayakārī tu bhuktimuktimavāpnuyāt /
column2: One who builds sixteen abodes gets enjoyment and emancipation.

column1: kaniṣṭhaṃ madhyamaṃ śreṣṭhaṃ kārayitvā harergṛhaṃ // svargaṃ ca vaiṣṇavaṃ lokaṃ mokṣamāpnoti ca kramāt /
column2: Having built a small, medium or excellent temple for Hari one gets heaven or the world of Viṣṇu or emancipation respectively in order.

column1: śreṣṭhamāyatanaṃ viṣṇoḥ kṛtvā yaddhanavān labhet // kaniṣṭhenaiva tat puṇyaṃ prāpnotyadhanavānnaraḥ /
column2: Which merits a rich man would get by erecting an excellent temple of Viṣṇu, a poor man would get by erecting a small temple itself.

column1: samutpādya dhanaṃ kṛtyā svalpenāpi surālayaṃ // kārayitvā hareḥ puṇyaṃ samprāpnotyadhikaṃ varaṃ /
column2: Having acquired riches and built a temple for Hari even with a small portion of it one would get excellent and enormous merits.

column1: lakṣaṇātha sahasreṇa śatenārdhena vā hareḥ // kārayan bhavanaṃ yāti yatrāste garuḍadhvajaḥ /
column2: By erecting a temple of Hari with a lakh or thousand or hundred or fifty units of money one would reach the place of that person who has the eagle in his banner.

column1: bālye tu krīḍamāṇā ye pāṃśubhirbhavanaṃ hareḥ // vāsudevasya kurvanti tepi tallokagāminaḥ /
column2: Those who play in their childhood with the building of abodes of Hari with earth also go to the world of Vāsudeva.

column1: tīrthe cāyatane puṇye saddhakṣetre tathāṣṭame // karturāyatanaṃ viṣṇoryathoktāttriguṇaṃ phalaṃ /
column2: The building of temples of Viṣṇu at holy places, within temples, accomplished place or hermitage yields threefold benefit than those already described.

column1: bandhūkapuṣpavinyāsaiḥ sudhāpaṅkena vaiṣṇavaṃ // ye vilimpanti bhavanaṃ te yānti bhagavatpuraṃ /
column2: Those who decorate the temple ofViṣṇu with the bandhūka flowers and an oint with fragrant paste, also reach the place of the lord.

column1: samuddhṛtya harerdhāma prāpnoti dviguṇaṃ phalaṃ /
column2: Having erected the temple of Hari, a person obtains twofold merits after having elevated the fallen, the falling and halffallen.

column1: patitasya tu yaḥ kartā patitasya ca rakṣitā //
column2: He who brings about the fall of a man is the protector of one fallen.

column1: iṣṭakānicayastiṣṭhed yāvadāyatane hareḥ // sakulastasya vai kartā viṣṇuloke mahīyate /
column2: By erecting a temple of Viṣṇu one reaches his region. As long as the bricks remain in the temple of Hari, the founder of that family is honoured in the world of Viṣṇu.

column1: sa eva puṇyavān pūjya iha loke paratra ca //
column2: He becomes pious and adorable in this world as well as the next.

column1: kṛṣṇasya vāsudevasya yaḥ kārayati ketanaṃ / jātaḥ sa eva sukṛtī kulantenaiva pāvitaṃ //
column2: He who builds a temple for Kṛṣṇa, the son of Vasudeva is born as a man of good deeds and his family gets purified.

column1: viṣṇurudrārkadevyādergṛhakartā sa kīrtibhāk /
column2: He who builds an abode for Viṣṇu, Rudra, Sun or the goddess etc.

column1: kiṃ tasya vittanicayair mūḍhasya parirakṣitaḥ //
column2: What is the use of the hoarded riches for an ignorant person?

column1: duḥkhārjitair yaḥ kṛṣṇasya na kārayati ketanaṃ / nopabhogyaṃ dhanaṃ yasya pitṛvipradivaukasāṃ // nopabhogāya bandhūnāṃ vyarthastasya dhanāgamaḥ /
column2: If one does not cause an abode for Kṛṣṇa to be built with wealth acquired by hard work and if one’s wealth could not be enjoyed by manes, brahmins, celestials and relatives, his acquisition of wealth is useless.

column1: yathā dhruvo nṛṇāṃ mṛtyurvittanāśas tathā dhruvaḥ //
column2: As death is certain for a man so also the destruction of wealth.

column1: mūḍhastatrānubadhnāti jīvitetha cale ghane / yadā vittaṃ na dānāya nopabhogāya dehināṃ // nāpi kīrtyai na dharmāthaṃ tasya svāmyetha ko guṇaḥ /
column2: One who does not spend his riches for charities or for enjoyments is stupid and is being bound even while alive, while the riches are flickery. Is there any merit in being the lord of wealth acquired either accidentally or by one’s effort, if it is not spent for acquiring fame or for philanthropy?

column1: dadyāt samyag dvijāgryebhyaḥ kīrtanāni ca kārayet /
column2: One may give to the foremost brahmins and also do such acts which would glorify him.

column1: dānebhyaścādhikaṃ yasmāt kīrtanebhyo varaṃ yataḥ // atastatkārayeddhīmān viṣṇvādermandirādikaṃ /
column2: More than the charities and more than the acts which would glorify him, one has to build the temples of Viṣṇu and other gods.

column1: viniveśya harerdhāma bhaktimadbhir narottamaiḥ // niveśitaṃ bhavet kṛtsnaṃ trailokyaṃ sacarācaraṃ /
column2: The temple of Hari being set up by devoted great men, the three worlds, the movable and immovable things and the entire objects get established.

column1: bhūtaṃ bhavayam bhaviṣyañca sthūlaṃ sūkṣmaṃ tathetarat // ābrāhmastambaparyantaṃ sarvaṃ viṣṇoḥ samudbhavaṃ /
column2: All the things beginning with Brahmā to the Pillar, that has already born, that is being born, that is to be born, the gross, the minute and the other things are born of Viṣṇu.

column1: tasya devādidevasya sarvagasya mahātmanaḥ // niveśya bhavanaṃ viṣṇor na bhūyo bhuvi jāyate /
column2: Having set up an abode for that lord of lords, the omnipresent, the great Viṣṇu, one is not born again in this world.

column1: yathā viṣṇordhāmakṛtau phalaṃ tadvaddivaukasāṃ // śivabrahmārkavighneśacaṇḍīlakṣmyādikātmanāṃ /
column2: By building temples for the celestials, Śiva, Brahmā, Sun, Vighneśa lord of impediments, Caṇḍī Pārvatī, Lakṣmī and others a man reaps the same benefit as he would get for building an abode for Viṣṇu.

column1: devālayakṛteḥ puṇyaṃ pratimākaraṇedhikaṃ //
column2: Greater merit is acquired by installing images of gods.

column1: pratimāsthāpane yāge phalasyānto na vidyate /
column2: In the rites relating to installation of an idol there is no limit for the fruits gained.

column1: mṛṇmayāddāruje puṇyaṃ dārujādiṣṭkābhave // iṣṭakotthācchailaje syāddhemāderadhikaṃ phalaṃ /
column2: One made of bricks yields greater merit than that made of wood. One made of stones gives greater merit than that made of bricks. Images made of gold and other metals yield more benefits.

column1: saptajanmakṛtaṃ pāpaṃ prārambhādeva naśyati //
column2: Sins committed in seven births get destroyed even at the very commencement of installation.

column1: devālayasya svargī syānnarakaṃ na sa gacchati /
column2: One who builds a temple goes to heaven and never goes to hell.

column1: kulānāṃ śatamuddhṛtya viṣṇulokaṃ nayennaraḥ //
column2: Having elevated a hundred of his ancestors he conveys them to the world of Viṣṇu.

column1: yamo yamabhaṭānāha devamandirakāriṇaḥ /
column2: Yama god of death said to his emissaries

column1: pratimāpūjādikṛto nāneyā narakaṃ narāḥ // devālayādyakartāra āneyāste tu gocare /
column2: “Those men who build temples of gods and adore the idols are not to be brought to hell. Bring them to my view who have not built temples and other things.

column1: visāradhvaṃ yathānyāyanniyogo mama pālyatāṃ //
column2: Move around in the befitting way and execute my directive.

column1: nājñābhaṅgaṃ kariṣyanti bhavatāṃ jantavaḥ kvacit / kevalaṃ te jagattātamanantaṃ samupāśritāḥ //
column2: Except those who have resorted to Ananta, the father of the universe, no other beings would at any time disregard the command.

column1: bhavadbhiḥ parihartavyāsteṣāṃ nātrāsti saṃsthitiḥ /
column2: Those who are devotees of Viṣṇu and have their mind fixed on him have to be avoided by you. They are not to live here.

column1: pūjayanti sadā viṣṇuṃ te vastyājyāḥ sudūrataḥ /
column2: Those who always adore Viṣṇu should be avoided by you from a distance.

column1: yastiṣṭhan prasvapan gacchannuttiṣṭhan skhalite sthite // saṅkīrtayanti govindaṃ te vastyājyāḥ sudūrataḥ /
column2: Those who sing the glories of Govinda while standing or sleeping or walking or standing behind or stumbling or remaining at a place are to be avoided by you from a distance.

column1: nityanaimittikair devaṃ ye yajanti janārdanam //
column2: Those who worship Janārdana with obligatory and occasional rites are not to be beheld by you.

column1: nāvalokyā bhavadbhiste tadgatā yānti tadgatim /
column2: Those who follow this course attain good position.

column1: ye puṣpadhūpavāsobhirbhūṣaṇaiścātivallabhaiḥ // arcayanti na te grāhyā narāḥ kṛṣṇālaye gatāḥ /
column2: Those who worship the god with flowers, incense, raiments, favourite ornaments, and those who have gone to the abode of Kṣṣṇa are not to be seized by you.

column1: upalepanakartāraḥ sammārjanaparāś ca ye // kṛṣṇālaye parityajyāsteṣāṃ putrās tathā kulam /
column2: Those who besmear with unguents, and those who are engaged in sprinkling his body, their children and their descendants should be left in the temple of Kṛṣṇa.

column1: yena cāyatanaṃ viṣṇoḥ kāritaṃ tatkulodbhavam // puṃsāṃ śataṃ nāvalokyaṃ bhavadbhirduṣṭacetasā /
column2: Hundreds of men born in the family of one who has built the temple of Viṣṇu should not be seen by you with evil mind.

column1: yastu devālayaṃ viṣṇordāruśailamayaṃ tathā // kārayen mṛṇmayaṃ vāpi sarvapāpaiḥ pramucyate /
column2: Whoever builds a temple of Viṣṇu with wood or stone or earth gets free from all sins.

column1: ahanyahani yajñena yajato yan mahāphalam // prāpnoti tat phalaṃ viṣṇoryaḥ kārayati ketanaṃ /

column1: sūtrāṇyūrdhvaṃ pradeyāni saptaiva kamalodbhava //

column1: aṣṭāṅgulaṃ lalāṭantu vistāreṇa prakīrtitam //

column1: pareṇa dvyaṅgulau śaṅkhau kartavyāvalakānvitau /

column1: caturaṅgulamākhyātamantaraṃ karṇanetrayoḥ //

column1: dvyaṅgulau pṛthukau karṇau karṇāpāṅgārdhapañcame /

column1: bhrūsamena tu sūtreṇa karṇaśrotraṃ prakīrtitam //
column2: The cavity in the ear is spoken to be in the same line as the eyebrows.

column1: viddhaṃ ṣaḍaṅgulaṃ karṇamaviddhañcaturaṅgulam /

column2: Or it should be six aṅgulas whether it is pierced or not pierced.

column2: The lower lip should be of two aṅgulas and the upper lip should be half of it.

column1: āyāmena tu vaipulyāt sārdhamaṅgulamucyate //

column1: avyāttamevaṃ syādvaktraṃ vyāttaṃ tryaṅgulamiṣyate /

column1: tārā netratribhāgeṇa dṛktārā pañcamāṃśikā //

column1: saptadaśāṅgulo madhye kūrpārordhe ca ṣoḍaśa /

column1: kūrpārasya bhavennāhaḥ triguṇaḥ kamalodbhava //

column1: tarjanyanāmikā caiva tasmādardhāṅgulaṃ vinā /

column2: Also called Golaka. One eighth of an aṅgula. Seems to be a corrupt form for mukhya equal to one tāla or twelve aṅgulas. shall describe the characteristics of the pedestal.

column1: tyaktvā paṅktidvayaṃ cādhastadūrdhvaṃ yattu koṣṭhakam /
column2: The length is the same as that of the image. The height should be half of it.

column1: caturdhā bhājayitvā tu ūrdhvapaṅktidvayaṃ budhaḥ //

column2: The eye should be made long measuring three parts of a yava less than three yavas.

column1: madhyapārśvaṃ ca tadvṛttaṃ ghanaṃ pīnaṃ kucadvayaṃ //

column2: The beasts should be made to measure a tāla. The waist should be one and a half kalās.

column1: vāsudevo 'sito dvāre śālagrāmadvicakrakaḥ //
column2: The stone called Vāsudeva is black coloured around its mouth and has marks of two discs on it.

column2: The Saṅkarṣaṇa stone is red in colour and has marks The Aniruddha stone is yellow in colour and has the mark of a lotus.

column1: pīto niruddhaḥ padmāṅgo vartulo dvitrirekhavān /
column2: It is circular in shape and has two or three rays.

column1: kṛṣṇo nārāyaṇo nābhyunnataḥ śuṣiradīrghavān //
column2: The Nārāyaṇa stone is black in colour with an elevated, and deep hole.

column2: The Viṣṇu stone has a big disc mark. It is black in colour. It has a line in the middle part.

column2: The Hayagrīva stone has a line of the shape of a good. It is blue coloured and is dotted. The Vaikuṇṭha stone has the mark of a disc and lotus. It has the radiance of a gem.

column1: matsyo dīrghastrivinduḥ syāt kācavarṇastu pūritaḥ /
column2: The Matsya stone is long and has three dots. It is crystallinecoloured and is well formed.

column1: sthūlo dāmodaro madhyacakro dvāḥsūkṣmavindukaḥ //

column1: tricakraścācyuto devastricakrako vā trivikramaḥ //
column2: The Acyuta stone has the marks of three discs. Or the Trivikrama stone may have the marks of three discs.

column1: janārdanaś catuś cakro vāsudevaś ca pañcabhiḥ /
column2: The Janārdana stone has the marks of four discs. The Vāsudeva stone has the marks of five discs.

column1: ṣaṭvakraś caiva pradyumnaḥ saṅkarṣaṇañca saptabhiḥ //
column2: The Pradyumna stone has the marks of six discs. The Saṅkarṣaṇa. stone has the marks of seven discs.

column1: puruṣottamoṣṭacakro navavyūho navāṅkitaḥ /
column2: The Puruṣottama stone has the marks of eight discs. The Navavyūha form has the marks of nine discs.

column1: daśāvatāro daśabhirdaśaikenāniruddhakaḥ /
column2: The stone representing the ten manifestations of Viṣṇu is marked with ten discs.

column1: dvādaśātmā dvādaśabhirata ūrdhvamanantakaḥ //
column2: The Dvādaśātman class of śālagrāma is marked by twelve discs.

column1: śālagrāmādicakrāṅkapūjāḥ siddhyai vadāmi te /
column2: shall describe the mode of worshipping the śālagrāma marked with discs for the sake of accomplishment.

column1: trividhā syāddhareḥ pūjā kāmyākāmyobhayātmikā //
column2: The worship of Hari in the śālagrāma is of three kinds i kāmyā performed for gaining particular benefit

column1: mīnādīnāntu pañcānāṃ kāmyātho vobhayātmikā / varāhasya nṛsiṃhasya vāmanasya ca muktaye //
column2: The worship of the five manifestations of Viṣṇu such as the Fish etc., is, either kāmyā or ubhayātmikā The worship of the manifestations of the Boar Manlion and Dwarf forms of Viṣṇu is for emancipation.

column1: cakrādīnāṃ trayāṇāntu śālagrāmārcanaṃ śṛṇu /
column2: Listen to the threefold worship of the śālagrāma endowed with discs.

column1: uttamā niṣphalā pūjā kaniṣṭhā saphalārcanā //
column2: The excellent worship is that performed without desiring for the fruits.

column1: madhyamā mūrtipūjā syāccakrābje caturasrake / praṇavaṃ hṛdi vinyasya ṣaḍaṅgaṅkaradehayoḥ // kṛtamudrātrayaś cakrād vahiḥ pūve guruṃ yajet /
column2: The worship of an image is mediocre. In a circular lotus placed on a rectaṅgular seat, having assigned the praṇava the syllable Oṃ to the heart and having assigned the sacred syllables to the parts of the body and having shown three mudrās positions of fingers in the practice of worship, the preceptor should be worshipped outside the circle.

column1: āpye gaṇaṃ vāyave ca dhātāraṃ nairṛte yajet //
column2: The attendant gods gaṇas should be worshipped on the west.

column1: vidhātārañca kartāraṃ hartāraṃ dakṣasaumyayoḥ / viśvaksenaṃ yajedīśe āgneye kṣetrapālakam //
column2: Dhātṛ on the northwest, Vidhātṛ on the southwest, the Kartā and Hartā on the south and north, Viṣvaksena Viṣṇushould be worshipped in the northeast, and Kṣetrapālaka the guardian deity on the southeast.

column1: ṛgādivedān prāgādau ādhārānantakaṃ bhuvaṃ /
column2: The Vedas, Ṛgveda etc. should be worshipped in the east etc.

column1: pīṭhaṃ padmaṃ cārkacandravahnyākhyaṃ maṇḍalatrayaṃ //
column2: The serpent Ananta which is the support of the earth, the seat of worship, the lotus, the three orbssun, moon and fires should be worshipped.

column1: āsanaṃ dvādaśārṇena tatra sthāpya śilāṃ yajet / astena ca samastena svavījena yajet kramāt //
column2: The seat should consist of twelve letters forming the mystic formula of the God. Having placed the God there, the stone should be worshipped with the individual syllables and the whole of the sacred syllable in order.

column1: pūrvādāvatha vedādyair gāyatrībhyāṃ jitādinā / praṇavenārcayet pañcānmudrāstisraḥ pradarśayet //
column2: Then one should worship with the vedic sacred syllables accomplished by the syllables such as the gāyatrī, etc. and praṇava on the east and other directions.

column1: viśvaksenasya cakrasya kṣetrapālasya darśayet /
column2: Then the three mudrās of the Viṣvaksena Viṣṇu, the disc and the Kṣetrapāla should be shown.

column1: śālagrāmasya prathamā pūjārtho niṣphalocyate //
column2: This is the first variety of the worship of śālagrāma.

column1: pūrvavat ṣoḍaśārañca sapadmaṃ maṇḍalaṃ likhet /
column2: One should draw a circle as before with sixteen radii and with a lotus.

column1: śaṅkhacakragadākhaḍgair gurvādyaṃ pūrvavadyajet // pūrve saumye dhanurvāṇān vedādyair āsanaṃ dadet /
column2: One should then worship the preceptor and others with a conch, disc, mace and sword. The bow and the arrows should be placed in the east and the north. The seat should be placed with the vedic syllables.

column1: śilāṃ nyased dvādaśārṇaistṛtīyaṃ pūjanaṃ śṛṇu //
column2: The stone should be placed with the sacred twelve syllables of the lord. Listen to the third variety of worship.

column1: aṣṭāramabjaṃ vilikhet gurvādyaṃ pūrvavadyajayet / aṣṭārṇenāsanaṃ datvā tenaiva ca śilāṃ nyaset /
column2: One should draw a lotus having eight radii and worship the preceptor and others as before. Having offered the seat with the eight sacred letters one should place the stone with the same formula.

column1: pūjayeddaśadhā tena gāyatrībhyāṃ jitaṃ tathā //
column2: One should worship ten times with that formula. It is then accomplished by gāyatrī etc.

column1: oṃrūpaḥ keśavaḥ padmaśaṅkhacakragadādharaḥ /
column2: Keśava of the form of syllable Oṃ bears the lotus, conch, disc and mace.

column1: nārāyaṇaḥ śaṅkhapadmagadācakrī pradakṣiṇaṃ //
column2: Nārāyaṇa bears the conch, lotus, mace and disc.

column1: tato gado mādhavoriśaṅkhapadmī namāmi taṃ / cakrakaumodakīpadmaśaṅkhī govinda ūrjitaḥ //
column2: Circumambulation to Him. Then salute Madhava, who bears the mace, disc, conch and lotus. Govinda wields the disc, the Kaumodakī name of a mace, lotus and conch.

column1: bhokṣadaḥ śrīgadī padmī śaṅkhī viṣṇuś ca cakradhṛk /
column2: Viṣṇu, the bearer of the disc, the mace, lotus and conch is the bestower of emancipation.

column1: śaṅkhacakrābjagadinaṃ madhusūdanamāname //
column2: salute Madhusūdana, who bears the conch, disc, lotus and mace.

column1: bhaktyā trivikramaḥ padmagadī cakrī ca śaṅkhyapi /
column2: prostrate with devotion at the feet of Trivikrama who bears the lotus, mace, disc and conch.

column1: śaṅkhacakragadāpadmī vāmanaḥ pātu māṃ sadā //
column2: May Vāmana, the bearer of the conch, disc, mace and lotus protect me always.

column1: gaditaḥ śrīdharaḥ padmī cakraśārṅgī ca śaṅkhyapi /
column2: Śrīdhara who holds a lotus, disc, bow and also the conch yields emancipation.

column1: hṛṣīkeśo gadācakrī padmī cakraśaṅkhī ca pātu naḥ //
column2: Hṛṣīkeśa wields the mace, disc, lotus and conch. May He protect us.

column1: varadaḥ padmanābhastu śaṅkhābjārigadādharaḥ / dāmodaraḥ padmaśaṅkhagadācakrī namāmi taṃ //
column2: And Padmanābha is one who yields boons and who holds the conch, lotus, disc and mace, salute him. Dāmodara is one who holds a lotus, conch, mace and disc.

column1: tene gadī śaṅkhacakrī vāsudevobjabhṛjjagat / saṅkarṣaṇo gadī śaṅkhī padmī cakrī ca pātu vaḥ //
column2: May Vāsudeva, who wields a mace, conch, disc and lotus protect the universe. May Saṅkarṣaṇa, who holds a mace, conch, lotus and disc protect us.

column1: gadī cakrī śaṅkhagadī pradyumnaḥ padmabhṛt prabhuḥ /
column2: Lord Pradyumna is one who holds a mace, disc, conch and mace as well as a lotus.

column1: aniruddhaś cakragadī śaṅkhī padmī ca pātu naḥ //
column2: May Aniruddha, who wields the disc, mace, conch and lotus protect us.

column1: adhokṣajaḥ padmagadī śaṅkhī cakrī ca pātu vaḥ //
column2: May Adhokṣaja who wields lotus, mace, conch and disc protect you.

column1: devo nṛsiṃhaś cakrābjagadāśaṅkhī namāmi tam /
column2: salute that Lord Nṛsiṃha, who wields disc, lotus, mace and conch.

column1: acyutaḥ śrīgadī padmī cakrī śaṅkhī ca pātu vaḥ // bālarūpī śaṅkhagadī upendraś cakrapadmyapi /
column2: May Acyuta, who holds mace, lotus, disc and conch, protect you all. So also may Upendra, who is of the form of a child and who holds the disc and lotus, protect you.

column1: janārdanaḥ padmacakrī śaṅkhadhārī gadādharaḥ //
column2: And may Janārdana, who wields lotus, disc, conch and mace protect you.

column1: śaṅkhī padmī ca cakrī ca hariḥ kaumodakīdharaḥ / kṛṣṇaḥ śaṅkhī gadī padmī cakrī me bhuktimuktidaḥ //
column2: May Hari, who holds conch, lotus, disc as well as mace kaumodakī yield me enjoyment and emancipation. May Kṛṣṇa, who holds conch, mace, lotus and disc give enjoyment and emancipation.

column1: ādimūttirvāsudevastasmāt saṅkarṣaṇobhavat /
column2: The first manifestation was that of Vāsudeva.

column1: saṅkarṣaṇācca pradyumnaḥ pradyumnādaniruddhakaḥ //
column2: Pradyumna manifested from Saṅkarṣaṇa. Aniruddha appeared from Pradyumna.

column1: keśavādiprabhedena aikaikasya tridhā kramāt /
column2: Each one of the above forms was divided into three forms such as Keśava and others.

column1: dvādaśākṣarakaṃ stotraṃ caturviṃśatimūrtimat / yaḥ paṭhecchṛṇuyādvāpi nirmalaḥ sarvamāpnuyāt //
column2: One who reads or hears this hymn consisting of twelve letters on the twentyfour forms gets free from impurity and gets all things.

column1: daśāvatāraṃ matsyādilakṣaṇaṃ pravadāmi te /
column2: shall describe to you the characteristics of the ten manifestations of Viṣṇu beginning with the Fish.

column1: matsyākārastu matsyaḥ syāt kūrmaḥ kārmākṛlirbhavet //
column2: The Fish form of Viṣṇu should resemble a fish. The Tortoise form should resemble a tortoise.

column1: narāṅgo vātha kartavyo bhūvarāho gadādibhṛt / dakṣiṇe vāmake śaṅkhaṃ lakṣmīrvā padmameva vā // śrīvāmakūrparasthā tu kṣmānantau caraṇānugau /
column2: The terrestrial boar manifestation should have a human body and as carrying a mace and other weapons in the right hand, and the conch, the goddess Lakṣmī or a lotus in the left. Or the goddess is represented as resting on the left elbow and the earth and the serpent Ananta at the feet.

column1: varāhasthāpanādrājyaṃ bhavābdhitaraṇaṃ bhavet // narasiṃho vivṛttāsyo vāmorukṣatadānavaḥ / tadvakṣo dārayanmālī sphuraccakragadādharaḥ //
column2: The installation of the figure secures for a person a kingdom and such a person gets across the ocean of mundane existence. The Manlion image should be represented as having a wide open mouth and having the killed demon Hiraṇyakaśipu on the left thigh.

column1: chatrī daṇḍī vāmanaḥ syādathavā syāccaturbhujaḥ /
column2: His chest should wear a garland and his arms should hold disc and mace. The Dwarfform may hold an umbrella and a stick or have four arms.

column1: rāmaścāpī śarī khaḍgī śaṅkhī vā dvibhujaḥ smṛtaḥ / gadālāṅgaladhārī ca rāmo vātha caturbhujaḥ //
column2: The figure of Paraśurāma may hold the bow and arrow, a sword and an axe. The figure of Rama should have the bow, arrow, sword, conch or two hands or may have four arms holding a mace and. plough.

column1: vāmordhve lāṅgalaṃ dadyādadhaḥ śaṅkhaṃ suśobhanaṃ / muṣalaṃ dakṣiṇordhve tu cakrañcādhaḥ suśobhanaṃ //
column2: The plough may be provided on the left half upper arm and the auspicious conch on the lower arm. The mace may be provided on the right half upper arm and the auspicious disc on the lower arm.

column1: śāntātmā lambakarṇaś ca gaurāṅgaścāmbarāvṛtaḥ / ūrdhvapadmasthito buddho varadābhayadāyakaḥ //
column2: The figure of Buddha should be made as calm, having long ears, white complexion, wearing a cloth, and seated on a lotus with its petals upwards and as conferring favour and protection.

column1: dhanustūṇānvitaḥ kalkī mlecchotsādakaro dvijaḥ /
column2: The figure of Kalki is to be represented as a twiceborn endowed with a bow and quiver and as destroying the foreigners.

column1: athavāśvasthitaḥ khaḍgī śaṅkhacakraśarānvitaḥ //
column2: Or he should be represented as seated on the horse and endowed with a sword, conch, disc and arrow.

column1: lakṣaṇaṃ vāsudevādinavakasya vadāmi te /
column2: shall describe the characteristics of nine forms of Viṣṇu commencing with Vāsudeva.

column1: dakṣiṇordhve gadā vāme vāmordhve cakramuttamaṃ //
column2: The mace is placed on the right half upper arm and the excellent disc on the left half upper arm.

column1: brahmeśau pārśvagau nityaṃ vāsudevosti pūrvavat / śaṅkhī sa varado vātha dvibhujo vā caturbhujaḥ //
column2: The image of Vāsudeva may be made as before or as having four hands or two hands, one holding a conch and the other as conferring boons and having Brahmā and Īśa Śiva always on either side.

column1: lāṅgalī muṣalī rāmo gadāpadmadharaḥ smṛtaḥ /
column2: The figure of Balarāma is represented as holding a plough, mace, club and lotus.

column1: pradyumno dakṣiṇe vajraṃ śaṅkhaṃ vāme dhanuḥ kare //
column2: The image of Pradyumna is represented as having thunderbolt and conch on the right arm and the bow in the left arm.

column1: gadānābhyāvṛtaḥ pītyā pradyumno vā dhanuḥśarī /
column2: Or Pradyumna is represented as having the mace resting on the navel with pleasure or holding the bow and arrow.

column1: caturbhujo niruddhaḥ syāttathā nārāyaṇo vibhuḥ //
column2: Aniruddha may be represented as having four arms. In the same way Lord Nārāyaṇa may also be represented.

column1: caturmukhaś caturbāhurvṛhajjaṭharamaṇḍalaḥ / lambakūrco jaṭāyukto vrahmā haṃsāgravāhanaḥ //
column2: The image of Brahmā is represented as having four faces, four hands, big belly, long beards, matted hair, and having swan as the vehicle in front of him.

column1: dakṣiṇe cākṣasūtrañca sruvo vāme tu kuṇḍikā /
column2: There should be a rosary and a ladle on the right hand and a waterpot and vessel to hold the sacrificial clarified butter.

column1: ājyasthālī sarasvatī sāvitrī vāmadakṣiṇe //
column2: Sarasvatī and Sāvitrī consorts of Brahmā should be placed on the left and right sides.

column1: viṣṇuraṣṭabhujastārkṣe kare khaḍgastu dakṣiṇe / gadāśaraś ca varado vāme kārmukakheṭake //
column2: The image of Viṣṇu is represented as having eight hands, Garuḍa the vehicle, holding a sword, mace, and arrow in the right hand and as conferring gifts and holding the bow and mace in the left hand.

column1: cakraśaṅkhau caturbāhur narasiṃhaś caturbhujaḥ / śaṅkhacakradharo vāpi vidāritamahāsuraḥ // acaturbāhurvarāhastu śeṣaḥ pāṇitale dhṛtaḥ / dhārayan bāhunā pṛthvīṃ vāmnena kamalādharaḥ //
column2: The figure of Narasiṃha is represented as having four hands holding the conch and disc and piercing the body of the mighty demon Hiraṇyakaśipu. The figure of Varāha is endowed with four arms holding the serpent Śeṣa in one of the hands and the earth in the left hand and his consort Kamalā Lakṣmī.

column1: pādalagnā dharā kāryā padā lakṣmīrvyavasthitā /
column2: The earth should be made as resting at the feet and goddess Lakṣmī as seated at the feet.

column1: trailokyamohanastārkṣye aṣṭabāhustu dakṣiṇe // cakraṃ khaḍgaṃ ca muṣalaṃ aṅkuśaṃ vāmake kare / śaṅkhaśārṅgagadāpāśān padmavīṇāsamanvite //
column2: Trailokyamohana one who stupefies the three worlds should be represented as riding the Tārkhya the eaglevehicle and possess eight hands, holding the sword, mace and goad in the right hand and the conch, bow, mace and the noose in the left hand.

column1: lakṣmīḥ sarasvatī kārye viśvarūpo 'tha dakṣiṇe /
column2: Images of Lakṣmī and Sarasvatī should be endowed with lotus and lute respectively.

column1: mudgaraṃ ca tathā pāśaṃ śaktiśūlaṃ śaraṃ kare // vāme śaṅkhañca śārṅgañca gadāṃ pāśaṃ ca tomaraṃ / lāṅgalaṃ paraśuṃ daṇḍaṃ churikāṃ carmakṣepakaṃ // viṃśadbāhuś caturvaktro dakṣiṇasthotha vāmake /
column2: Then the form of Viśvarūpa of Viṣṇu should be endowed with the club, noose, spear and arrow in the right hand and conch, bow, mace, noose, tomara javelin, plough, axe, staff, sword and leather sling in the left hand. The Harihara Śiva and Viṣṇu form of Viṣṇu should be placed on the right or left side, being endowed with twenty hands, four faces and three eyes.

column1: trinetre vāmapārśve na śayito jalaśāyyapi //
column2: He should either be lying on his left or reclining on the water.

column1: śriyā dhṛtaikacaraṇo vimalādyābhirīḍitaḥ /
column2: He should also be shown as being attended to by the female divinities Vimalā and others.

column1: nābhipadmacaturvaktro hariśaṅkarako hariḥ // śūlarṣṭidhārī dakṣe ca gadācakradharo pade / rudrakeśavalakṣmāṅgo gaurīlakṣmīsamanvitaḥ //
column2: He should also have the fourfaced Brahmā in the navellotus. The form of Viṣṇu bearing the marks of Rudra and Keśava should hold a spear and sword in the right hand and the mace and disc in the other and be in the company of Gaurī and Lakṣmī the consorts of Śiva and Viṣṇu.

column1: śaṅkhacakragadāvedapāṇiścāśvaśirā hariḥ / vāmapādo dhṛtaḥ śeṣe dakṣiṇaḥ kūrmapṛṣṭhagaḥ //
column2: The Hayaśiras horseheaded form of Viṣṇu should be represented as holding the conch, disc, mace and the Vedas. The left foot should rest on the serpent Śeṣa and the right on the back of tortoise.

column1: dattātreyo dvibāhuḥ syādvāmotsaṅge śriyā saha /
column2: The form of Dattātreya may have two arms, the goddess Śrī Lakṣmī being seated on the left lap.

column1: viśvaksenaś cakragadī halī śaṅkhī harergaṇaḥ // caṇḍī viṃśatibāhuḥ syādbibhratī dakṣiṇaiḥ karaḥ / śūlāsiśakticakrāṇi pāśaṃ kheṭāyudhābhayaṃ // ḍamaruṃ śaktikāṃ vāmair nāgapāśañca kheṭakaṃ /
column2: The Viṣvaksena form of Viṣṇu may hold a disc, mace, plough and conch. The image of Caṇḍī may have twenty hands and may hold the spear, sword, dart, disc, noose, club, ḍamaru a small drum and spike in the left hands and also show protective posture and the snake as the noose, club, axe, goad, bow, bell, banner, mace, mirror, and iron mace in the right hands..

column1: kuṭhāṅkuśacāpāṃś ca ghaṇṭādhvajagadāṃs tathā // ādarśamudgarān hastaiś caṇḍī vā daśabāhukā / tadadho mahiṣaśchinnamūrdhā patitamastakaḥ //
column2: Or the figure of Caṇḍī is made to have ten hands, with the buffalo placed below with its head fully severed and the demon as issuing forth from its neck with rage and brandishing his weapon, holding spike in the hand, vomitting blood, his hairs.

column1: śastrodyatakaraḥ kruddhastadgrīvāsambhavaḥ pumān / śūlahasto vamadrakto raktasraṅmūrdhajekṣaṇaḥ //
column2: stained with blood and blood dripping out from the eyes. forming a garland on the chest, being devoured by the lion and wellbound by the noose in the neck.

column1: siṃhenāsvādyamānastu pāśabaddho gale bhṛśaṃ / yāmyāṅghyrākrāntasiṃhā ca savyāṅghrirnīcagāsure //
column2: The goddess is represented as resting her right foot on the lion and the left foot on. the demon underneath. This form of Caṇḍikā, the destroyer of enemies.

column1: caṇḍikeyaṃ trinetrā ca saśastrā ripumardanī /
column2: is made as having three eyes and endowed with weapons.

column1: navapadmātmake sthāne pūjyā durgā svamūrtitaḥ // ādau madhye tathendrādau navātattvātmabhiḥ kramāt /
column2: This Durgā is to be worshipped with the nine elements in order in a diagram of nine lotuses from her own form at the beginning, centre and the eastern and other directions.

column1: aṣṭādaśabhujaikā tu dakṣe muṇḍaṃ ca kheṭakaṃ // ādarśatarjanīcāpaṃ dhvajaṃ ḍamarukaṃ tathā /
column2: The image should be made as possessing eighteen arms carrying a human head, club, mirror, tarjanī a kind of weapon, bow, banner and.

column1: vajrakhaḍgāṅkuśaśarān cakrandevī śalākayā /
column2: a little drum in the right hand and the noose, spear, mace, trident, thunderbolt, sword, goad and dart in the left hand.

column1: etair evāyudhair yuktā śeṣāḥ ṣoḍaśabahukāḥ // ḍamaruṃ tarjanīṃ tyaktvā rudracaṇḍādayo nava /
column2: The others Rudracaṇḍā and other goddesses should be endowed with the same weapons in their sixteen hands except the little drum and tarjanī a kind of weapon.

column1: rudracaṇḍā pracaṇḍā ca caṇḍogrā caṇḍanāyikā // caṇḍā caṇdavatī caiva caṇḍarūpāticaṇḍikā /
column2: The nine goddesses commencing with Rudracaṇḍā are Rudracaṇḍā, Pracaṇḍā, Caṇḍogrā, Caṇḍanāyikā, Caṇḍā, Caṇḍavatī, Caṇḍarūpā, Aticaṇḍikā and Ugracaṇḍā stationed at the centre.

column1: ugracaṇḍā ca madhyasthā rocanābhāruṇāsitā //
column2: They are made to be coloured as the rocanā.

column1: nīlā śuklā dhūmrikā ca pītā śvetā ca siṃhagāḥ /
column2: yellow pigment, red, black, blue, white, purple, yellow and white and as riding the lion.

column1: mahiṣotha pumān śastrī tatkacagrahamuṣṭikāḥ // ālīḍhā nava durgāḥ syuḥ sthāpyāḥ putrādivṛddhaye /
column2: Then the buffalo as a human form should be held by the hair by the nine forms of Durgā holding weapons. They are in the ālīḍha posture.

column1: tathā gaurī ca caṇḍikādyā kuṇḍyakṣararadāgnidhṛk //

column2: The officiating priest has to arrange sheds measuring eight, sixteen or twenty cubits in front of the temple for bathing, the pitchers, and things required for the sacrifice by extending the side lines of the adytum.

column1: tribhāgeṇārdhabhāgena vediṃ kuryāttu śobhanām /
column2: The auspicious sacrificial platform should be made ready with one third or half of the above space.

column1: kalaśair ghaṭikābhiś ca vitānādyaiś ca bhūṣayet //
column2: It should be decked with pitchers big and small and canopies etc.

column1: pañcagavyena samprokṣya sarvadravyāṇi dhārayet /
column2: All the materials to be used in the rite should be cleansed with pañcagavya the five things extracted from a cow.

column1: alaṅkṛto gururviṣṇuṃ dhyātvātmānaṃ prapūjayet //
column2: The priest should adorn himself with ornaments. Having contemplated his own self as lord Viṣṇu, he should begin worship.

column1: aṅgulīyaprabhṛtibhirmūrtipān valayādibhiḥ / kuṇḍe kuṇḍe sthāpayecca mūrtipāṃstatra pāragān //
column2: The expert idolworshippers should be established in front of each pit intended for the rite. They should be endowed with rings, bracelets and other things.

column1: catuṣkoṇe cārdhakoṇe vartule padmasannibhe / pūrvādau toraṇārthantu pippaloḍumbarau vaṭaṃ //
column2: Logs of the pippala, udumbara, vaṭa trees should be planted at the doorways of the place for the sake of arches. The place may be quadrangular, semicircular, circular or lotusshaped.

column1: plakṣaṃ suśobhanaṃ pūrvaṃ subhadrandakṣatoraṇaṃ / sukarma ca suhotrañca āpye saumye samucchrayam //
column2: Log of the fig tree should adorn the east, of the subhadra the south, of the sukarma and suhotra the northern and western doorways respectively.

column1: pañcahastaṃ tu saṃsthāpya syonāpṛthvīti pūjayet / toraṇastambhamūle tu kalaśānmaṅgalāṅkurān //
column2: The pitchers having young sprouts of mango trees should be placed five cubits apart at the toot of each one of the supporting columns of the arches and be worshipped with the sacred syllables syonā pṛthivī.

column1: pradadyādupariṣṭācca kuryāccakraṃ sudarśanaṃ /
column2: The sudarśana disc of Viṣṇu should be placed at the top.

column1: pañcahastapramāṇantu dhvajaṃ kuryāddvicakṣaṇaḥ //
column2: A wise man has to make the banner five cubits long.

column1: vaipulyaṃ cāsya kurvīta ṣoḍaśāṅgulasanmitaṃ /
column2: It should be made sixteen fingers broad.

column1: saptahastocchritaṃ vāsya kuryāt kuṇḍaṃ surottama //
column2: O excellent among the celestials! the height should be seventeen cubits in the alternative.

column1: aruṇogninibhaś caiva kṛṣṇaḥ śuklotha pītakaḥ /
column2: The pit should be duly reddish, flamecoloured,. black, white, yellow, deep red, white and again white.

column1: kumudaḥ kumudākṣaś ca puṇḍarīkotha vāmanaḥ / śaṅkukarṇaḥ sarvanetraḥ sumukhaḥ supratiṣṭhitaḥ // pūjyā koṭiguṇair yuktāḥ pūrvādyā dhvajadevatāḥ /
column2: The presiding deities of the banners hoisted in the quarters east etc., such as Kumuda, Kumudākṣa, Puṇḍarīka, Vāmana, Saṅkarṣaṇa, Sarvanetra, Sumukha and Supratiṣṭhita, who are endowed with countless divine qualities should. be worshipped.

column1: jalāḍhakasupūrāstu pakvavimbopamā ghaṭāḥ // aṣṭāviṃśādhikaśataṃ kālamaṇḍanavarjitāḥ / sahiraṇyā vastrakaṇṭhāḥ sodakāstoraṇādvahiḥ //
column2: One hundred and eight pitchers resembling the ripe bimba fruit in colour, not having black spots and having been filled with water and gold and having pieces of cloth around their necks should be placed outside the arches.

column1: ghaṭāḥ sthāpyāś ca pūrvādau vedikāyāś ca koṇagān /
column2: Pitchers should be placed at the east and other directions.

column1: caturaḥ sthāpayet kumbhānājighreti ca mantrataḥ //
column2: Four pitchers should be placed at the corners of the sacrificial altar with the sacred syllable ājighra.

column1: kumbheṣvāvāhya śakrādīn pūrvādau pūjayet kramāt /
column2: After having invoked Indra and others in the pitchers. in the east etc. one should worship Indra.

column1: indrāgaccha devarāja vajrahasta gajasthita //
column2: O Indra, the lord of celestials, the wielder of thunderbolt, seated on the elephant you come.

column1: pūrvadvārañca me rakṣa devaiḥ saha namostu te /
column2: You protect the eastern door in the company of celestials. May salutations be to you.

column1: trātāramindramantreṇa arcayitvā yajed budhaḥ //
column2: After having worshipped Indra with the sacred syllable trātāram indra, the wise man should invoke him.

column1: āgacchāgre śaktiyuta cchāgastha balasaṃyuta /
column2: O Agni! endowed with a trident, seated on a goat and possessing strength you come and accept my worship.

column1: rakṣāgneyīṃ diśaṃ devaiḥ pūjāṃ gṛha namostu te //
column2: You protect the southeast in the company of celestials. Salutations to you.

column1: agnimūrdhetimantreṇa yajedvā āgneya namaḥ /
column2: One should worship Agni with the sacred syllable agnir mūrddhā. Salutations to Agni.

column1: mahiṣastha yamāgaccha daṇḍahasta mahābala //
column2: O Yama! seated on the buffalo, wielding the mace, and possessing great strength.

column1: rakṣa tvaṃ dakṣiṇadvāraṃ vaivasvata namostu te /
column2: you come. You protect the southern gate. O Yama! salutations to you.

column1: vaivasvataṃ saṅgamanamityanena yajedyamaṃ //
column2: Yama should be propitiated with the sacred syllable vaivasvataṃ saṅgamanam.

column1: nairṛtāgaccha khaḍgāḍhya balavāhanasaṃyuta /
column2: O Nairṛta! carrying a sword accompanied by an army and riding an animal, you come.

column1: idamarghyamidaṃ pādyaṃ rakṣa tvaṃ nairṛtīṃ diśaṃ //
column2: Here is the offering and water for washing the feet. You guard the southwestern direction.

column1: eṣa te nairṛte mantreṇa yajedarghyādibhir naraḥ /
column2: Men should worship with the sacred syllable eṣa te nirṛte and with offerings.

column1: makarārūḍha varuṇa pāśahasta mahābala //
column2: O Varuṇa! riding the crocodile, holding the noose and possessing great strength you come and protect the western doorway.

column1: āgaccha paścimaṃ dvāraṃ rakṣa rakṣa namostu te /
column2: Salutations to you.

column1: uruṃ hi rājā varuṇaṃ yajedarghyādibhirguruḥ //
column2: The preceptor should worship with the sacred syllable uruṃ hi rājā varuṇam and offerings.

column1: āgaccha vāyo sabala dhvajahasta savāhana /
column2: O Vāyu! endowed with strength, holding the banner, together with a vehicle you come.

column1: vāyavyaṃ rakṣa devaistvaṃ samarudbhir namostu te //
column2: You guard the northwestern direction in the company of celestials and Maruts groups of celestial gods. Salutations to you.

column1: vāta ity ādibhiścārvedonnamo vāyavepi vā /
column2: He should be worshipped with the sacred syllables vāta etc. or with ‘Oṃ! Salutations to Vāyu’.

column1: āgaccha soma sabalā gadāhasta savāhana //
column2: O Soma! you come with strength, wielding the mace and riding the vehicle.

column1: rakṣa tvamuttaradvāraṃ sakuvera namostu te /
column2: You protect the northern gate along with Kubera. Salutations to you.

column1: somaṃ rājānamiti vā yajetsomāya vai namaḥ //
column2: One should worship with the sacred syllable somaṃ rājānam or Salutations to Soma’.

column1: āgaccheśāna sabala śūlahasta vṛṣasthita / yajñamaṇḍapasyaiśānīṃ diśaṃ rakṣa namostu te //
column2: O Īsāna! you come along! possesser of strength, riding the bull. You guard the northeastern direction of the ritual pavilion. Salutations to you. He should be worshipped with the sacred syllable.

column1: īśānamasyeti yajedīśānāya namopi vā /
column2: īśānamasya or ‘Salutations to Īsāna’.

column1: brahmannāgaccha haṃsastha sruksruvavyagrahastaka // salokordhvāṃ diśaṃ rakṣa yajñasyāja namostu te /
column2: O Brahman! you come. Seated on a swan! Carrying the sacrificial vessel and ladle! You defend the direction above the sacrificial place, O unborn! Salutations to you.

column1: hiraṇyagarbheti yajennamaste brahmaṇepi vā //
column2: One should worship with the sacred syllable hiraṇyagarbha or ‘salutations to Brahman’.

column1: anantāgaccha cakrāḍhya kūrmasthāhigaṇeśvara / adhodiśaṃ rakṣa rakṣa ananteśa namostu te /
column2: O Ananta! you come. Endowed with the disc! Seated on the tortoise! Lord of the gaṇas. You protect the bottom of the sacrificial place. O Lord Ananta! Salutations to you.

column1: namostu sarpeti yajedanantāya namopi vā //
column2: One should worship with the sacred syllable ‘Salutations to serpent’ or ‘Salutations to Ananta’.

column1: bhūmeḥ parigrahaṃ kuryāt kṣipedbrīhīṃś ca sarṣapān / nārasiṃhena rakṣoghnān prokṣoghnān prokṣayet pañcagavyataḥ //
column2: One should do the ceremony of taking possession of the ground. One should scatter grains and mustard seeds uttering the sacred syllable ‘Nārasiṃha’ which destroys demons. One should sprinkle pañcagavya the five things got from a cow.

column1: bhūmiṃ ghaṭe tu sampūjya saratne sāṅgakaṃ hariṃ / astramantreṇa karakaṃ tatra cāṣṭaśataṃ yajet //
column2: Having worshipped the earth in the pitcher containing gems as well as Hari and his retinue, worship the eighteen pitchers therein with the sacred syllable of weapons.

column1: acchinnadhārayā siñcan brīhīn saṃskṛtya dhārayet / pradakṣiṇaṃ paribhrāmya kalaśaṃ vikiropari //
column2: The rice grains should be purified by an incessant shower of water and scattered around. The pitcher should be placed in their midst.

column1: savastre kalaśe bhūyaḥ pūjayedacyutaṃ śriyaṃ /
column2: Lord Acyuta and his consort Śrī should again be worshipped in the pitcher provided with a cloth.

column1: yoge yogeti mantreṇa nyasecchayyāntu maṇḍale // kuśopari tūlikāñca śayyāyāṃ digvidikṣu ca / vidyādhipān yajedviṣṇuṃ madhughātaṃ trivikramaṃ //
column2: The bed as well as the mattress should be spread on the kuśa grass on a drawn circle with the recitation of the sacred syllable yoge yoge. Lord Viṣṇu, the slayer of the demon Madhu and the lord of the three divisions of the universe and also the different lords of learning are worshipped on the bed.

column1: vāmanaṃ dikṣu vāyvādau śrīdharañca hṛṣīkapaṃ / padmanābhaṃ dāmodaramaiśānyāṃ snānamaṇḍape // abhyarcya paścādaiśānyāṃ catuṣkumbhe savedike / snānamaṇḍaṣake sarvadravyāṇyānīya nikṣipet //
column2: Having worshipped Vāmana, Śrīdhara, Hṛṣīkeśa, Padmanābha different forms of Viṣṇu in the northwest and other corners of the bathing place and the Dāmodara form of Viṣṇu in the northeast and having brought all the materials to the bathing pavilion they should be deposited in the four pitchers and the altar in the northeast.

column1: snānakumbheṣu kumbhāṃstāṃś caturdikṣvadhivāsayet /
column2: These pitchers should be consecrated in the four quarters with the pitchers containing water for the consecration.

column1: kalaśāḥ sthāpanīyāstu abhiṣekārthamādarāt //
column2: The pitchers should be placed with due regard for the purpose of consecration.

column1: vaṭodumbarakāśvatthāṃś campakāśokaśrīdrumān / palāśārjunaplakṣāṃstu kadambavakulāmrakān //
column2: The young sprouts from the vaṭa udumbara, aśvattha, campaka, aśoka, śrīdruma, palāśa, arjuna, plakṣa, kadamba, bakula and mango trees should be brought and put in the eastern pitcher.

column1: padmakaṃ rocanāṃ dūrvāṃ darbhapiñjalameva ca // jātīpuṣpaṃ kundapuṣpacandanaṃ raktacandanaṃ / siddhārthaṃ tagarañcaiva taṇḍulaṃ dakṣiṇe nyaset //
column2: The lotus, rocanā a kind of yellow pigment, dūrvā grass, darbha grass, piñjala yellow orpiment, the flowers jāti and kunda, pieces of sandal wood, red sandal, white mustard, tagara a kind of herb, and rice should be put on the southern one.

column1: nadyāḥ samudragāminyā viśeṣāt jāhnavīmṛdaṃ // gomayañca yavān śālīṃstilāṃś caivāpare nyaset /
column2: Silver and gold and earth from the two banks of rivers flowing into the ocean especially the earth from the river Jāhnavi Ganges, the urine of a cow, barley grains, paddy and sesamum should be placed in another pitcher.

column1: viṣṇuparṇīṃ śyāmalatāṃ bhṛṅgarājaṃ śatāvarīṃ // sahadevāṃ mahādevīṃ balāṃ vyaghrīṃ salakṣmaṇāṃ /
column2: The viṣṇuparṇī, śyāmalatā, bhṛṅgarāja, śatāvarī, sahadevī, mahādevī, balā and vyāghnī ?, the auspicious things are put in the other pitcher in the northeast.

column1: valmīkamṛttikāṃ saptasthānotthāmapare nyaset / jāhnavīvālukātoyaṃ vinyasedapare ghaṭe //
column2: The earth from an anthill obtained from seven different places should be put in another pitcher. The sand from the Ganges and its water should be put in another pitcher.

column1: varāhavṛṣanāgendraviṣāṇoddhṛtamṛttikāṃ / mṛttikāṃ padmamūlasya kuśasya tvapare nyaset //
column2: The earth loosened by the boars, bulls, and elephants. with their horns and tusks as well as earth from the root of the lotus and the kuśa grass should be placed in another pitcher.

column1: tīrthaparvatamṛdbhiś ca yuktamapyapare nyaset /
column2: One should put in another pitcher earth got from sacred places and hills.

column1: nāgakeśarapuṣpañca kāśmīramapare nyaset // candanāgurukarpūraiḥ puṣpaṃ caivāpare nyaset /
column2: The flowers of nāgakeśara and kāśmira should be put in another pitcher. Flowers together with the sandal wood, agallochum and camphor should be placed in another pitcher.

column1: vaidūryaṃ vidrumaṃ muktāṃ sphaṭikaṃ vajrameva ca // etānyekatra nikṣipya sthāpayeddevasattama /
column2: The gems lapis lazuli, coral, pearl, crystal, and diamond should be put earlier in one pitcher and placed firmly by the holy priests.

column1: nadīnadataḍāgānāṃ salilair aparaṃ nyaset //
column2: Another pitcher should be filled with the waters of the rivers and tanks.

column1: ekāśītipade cānyānmaṇḍape kalaśān nyaset / gandhodakādyaiḥ sampūrṇān śrīsūktenābhimantrayet //
column2: Another set of pitchers filled with perfumes etc. should be placed at eightyone places and consecrated with the śrīsūkta.

column1: yavaṃ siddhārthakaṃ gandhaṃ kuśāgraṃ cākṣataṃ tathā / tilān phalaṃ tathā puṣpamarghyārthaṃ pūrvato nyaset // padmaṃ śyāmalatāṃ dūrvāṃ viṣṇuparṇīṃ kuśāṃs tathā /
column2: Barley grains, white mustard, perfumes, tips of kuśa grass, unbroken rice, sesamum, fruits and flowers should be first placed for the sake of worship. The lotus, the creeper called śyāmalatā, dūrvā grass, leaf of holy basil and kuśa grass should be kept on the righthand side for being offered at the foot.

column1: pādyārthaṃ dakṣiṇe bhāge madhuparkaṃ tu dakṣiṇe //
column2: The madhuparka is also placed on the right side.

column1: kakkolakaṃ lavaṅgañca tathā jātīphalaṃ śubhaṃ / uttare hy ācamanāya agnau dūrvākṣatānvitaṃ //
column2: The kaṅkola, cloves and nutmeg along with the dūrvā grass and unbroken rice should be offered in the fire on the north for the sake of rinsing the mouth.

column1: pātraṃ nīrājanārthaṃ ca tathodvartanamānile / gandhapuṣpānvitaṃ pātramaiśānyāṃ pātrake nyaset //
column2: A vessel for offering camphor and perfumes to be applied on the body should be placed on the southeast. A vessel containing perfumes and flowers should be placed on the northeast.

column1: murāmāṃsī cāmalakaṃ sahadevāṃ niśādikaṃ /
column2: The murā, māṃsī, myrabolan, sahadevā and niśā and sixty lamps should be placed.

column1: ṣaṣṭidīpānnyasedaṣṭau nyasennīrājanāya ca //
column2: Eight lamps should be kept for the nirājana showing the light in adoration.

column1: śaṅkhaṃ cakrañca śrīvatsaṃ kuliśaṃ paṅkajādikaṃ /
column2: The conch, disc, śrīvatsa mark on the breast of Viṣṇu, thunderbolt, lotus etc.

column1: hemādipātre kṛtvā tu nānāvarṇādipuṣpakaṃ //
column2: should be placed in a golden vessel along with flowers of variegated colours.

column1: aiśānyāṃ janayet kuṇḍaṃ gururvahniñca vaiṣṇavaṃ / gāyatryaṣṭaśataṃ hutvā sampātavidhinā ghaṭān //
column2: The priest should get ready a pit for sacrificial fire in the northeast. The fire relating to Viṣṇu should be kindled with the recitation of gāyatrī one hundred and eight times.

column1: prokṣayet kāruśālāyāṃ śilpibhirmūrtipair vrajet / tūryaśabdaiḥ kautukañca bandhayeddakṣiṇe kare //
column2: Having cleansed the pitchers thoroughly and established the priest he should go to the shed where the image has been made ready accompanied by the sculptors and custodians of the idol and along with music of the instrument tūrya.

column1: viṣṇave śipiviṣṭeti ūrṇāsūtreṇa sarṣapaiḥ /
column2: The woollen thread containing mustard seeds should be tied on the right arm of the idol with the syllables Viṣṇave śipiviṣṭāya etc.

column1: paṭṭavastreṇa kartavyaṃ deśikasyāpi kautukaṃ //
column2: The priest should also have a piece of silk cloth tied to his arm.

column1: maṇḍape pratimāṃ sthāpya savastrāṃ pūjitān stuvan / namastercye sureśāni praṇīte viśvakarmaṇā // prabhāvitāśeṣajagaddhātri tubhyaṃ namo namaḥ /
column2: Having placed the idol in the pavilion and having adored and worshipped the dressed idol one has to say “ bow to you the sovereign lady of celestials who has been made ready by Viśvakarman the divine architect.” make obeisance to you who is resplendant and is the sustainer of the entire universe.

column1: tvayi sampūjayāmīśe nārāyaṇamanāmayaṃ //
column2: worship in you the healthy Lord Nārāyaṇa.

column1: rahitā śilpidoṣaistvamṛddhiyuktā sadā bhava /
column2: Be thou always prosperous goddess devoid of defects due to the sculptors.

column1: evaṃ vijñāpya pratimāṃ nayettāṃ snānamaṇḍapaṃ // śilpinantoṣayeddravyair gurave gāṃ pradāpayet /
column2: Having submitted thus that idol should be carried to the bathing pavilion . The sculptor should be satisfied by offering articles of present. A cow should be given as gift to the priest.

column1: citraṃ deveti mantreṇa netre conmīlayettataḥ //
column2: Then the eyes of the idol should be made open with the recitation of the syllable citraṃ deva.

column1: agnirjyotīti dṛṣṭiñca dadyādvai bhadrapīṭhake / tataḥ śuklāni puṣpāṇi ghṛtaṃ siddhārthakaṃ tathā //
column2: The sight should be endowed with the recitation of the syllable agnir jyoti. Then white flowers, ghee and mustard seeds should be placed on the pedestal.

column1: dūrvāṃ kuśāgraṃ devasya dadyācchirasi deśikaḥ /
column2: The priest should place dūrvā grass and tips of kuśa grass on the head of the deity.

column1: madhuvāteti mantreṇa netre cābhyañjayedguruḥ //
column2: Then the priest should anoint the eyes of the deity with the syllables madhu vātā.

column1: hiraṇyagarbhamantreṇa imaṃ meti ca kīrtayet /
column2: The syllables hiraṇyagarbha and imam me should be recited.

column1: ghṛtenābhyañjayet paścāt paṭhan ghṛtavatīṃ punaḥ // masūrapiṣṭe nodvartya ato deveti kīrtayan / kṣālayeduṣṇatoyena sapta te 'greti deśikaḥ //
column2: Then the idol should be anointed with ghee reciting the hymn ghṛtavatā. The flour paste of masūra a variety of grain should be rubbed on the deity reciting the hymn ato devā. Then the priest should wash the deity with hot water with the recitation of sapta te agne.

column1: drupadādivetyanulimpedāpo hi ṣṭheti secayet / nadījaistīrthajaiḥ snānaṃ pāvamānīti ratnajaiḥ //
column2: The image should be bathed with the waters of the rivers and sacred places with the syllables āpo hi ṣṭḥā and with the waters containing gems with the pāvamāna.

column1: samudraṃ gaccha candanaistīrthamṛtkalaśena ca /
column2: The image should be bathed with the waters of an earthern pot with the syllable samudraṃ gaccha.

column1: śanno devīḥ snāpayecca gāyatryāpyuṣṇavāriṇā //
column2: It should be consecrated with śanno devī and bathed with hot water consecrated by gāyatrī.

column1: pañcamṛddhirhiraṇyeti snāpayetparameśvaraṃ /
column2: The supreme god should be bathed with five kinds of earth with the syllable hiraṇya.

column1: sikatādbhirirmaṃ meti valmīkodaghaṭena ca //
column2: With pot made of earth of an anthill and sand waters and the syllable imam me it should be bathed.

column1: tadviṣṇoriti oṣadhyadbhiryā oṣadhīti mantrataḥ / yajñāyajñeti kāṣāyaiḥ pañcabhirgavyakaistataḥ //
column2: The image should be bathed with herbal waters with the syllable tadviṣṇoḥ and yā oṣadhī, with herbal decoctions with the syllable yajñāajñā and then with the pañcagavya the five things got from a cow.

column1: payaḥ pṛthivyāṃ mantreṇa yāḥ phalinī phalāmbubhiḥ / viśvataś cakṣuḥ saumyena pūrveṇa kalasena ca //
column2: The image should be bathed with the waters containing fruits with the syllables payaḥ pṛthivyām and yāḥ phalinī and with the contents of the pitchers kept in the north and east with the syllables viśvataścakṣuḥ.

column1: somaṃ rājānamityevaṃ viṣṇo rarāṭaṃ dakṣataḥ / haṃsaḥ śuciḥ paścimena kuryādudvartanaṃ hareḥ //
column2: The cleansing of the image of Hari Viṣṇu should be done with the recitation of the syllables somaṃ rājānam, viṣṇo rarāṭamasi from the right and with haṃsaḥ śuci on the west

column1: mūrdhānandivamantreṇa dhātrīṃ māṃsīṃ ca ke dadet /
column2: One should offer the dhātrī and māṃsī herbs on the head with the sacred syllables mūrdhānaṃ divā.

column1: mānastoketi mantreṇa gandhadvāreti gandhakaiḥ //
column2: One should bathe the image with perfumes with the syllables gandhadvāra and mā nas toka.

Oṃ, hāṃ obeisance to the principle of soul! Oṃ, hāṃ obeisance to lord Brahmā, lord of the principle of soul!” Each one of the principlesearth, fire, the sacrificer, sun, water, wind, moon and ether of the eight forms of the lord should be located in each one of the slabs along with their presiding deities Śarva, Paśupati, Ugra, Rudra, Bhava, Maheśvara, Mahādeva and Bhīma in order.
