column1: gairikaṃ hemamākṣīkaṃ pārado vahnigairikaṃ / gandhakābhrakamityaṣṭau dhātavo brīhayas tathā // godhūmān satilānmāṣānmudgānapyāharedyavān /
column2: Yellow orpiment, red arsenic, red chalk, suvarṇamākṣīka honeylike mineral, mercury, vahnigairika, sulphur, and mica are the eight kinds of minerals. The eight kinds of grains are stated to be wheat, sesamum, blackgram, greengram, barley, short term paddy, śyāmāka.

column1: nīvārān śyāmakānevaṃ brīhayo 'pyaṣṭa kīrtitāḥ //
column2: All these things should. be gathered.

column1: snātvā nityadvayaṃ kṛtvā praṇavārghakaro guruḥ / sahāyair mūrtipair vipraiḥ saha gacchenmakhālayaṃ //
column2: After having bathed and performed the two daily worships, the preceptor should enter the sacrificial shed with the argha offering in his hand and accompanied by the brahmins who are the protectors of the idols.

column1: kṣāntyāditoraṇāṃstatra pūrvavat pūjayet kramāt / pradakṣiṇakramādeṣāṃ śākhāyāṃ dvārapālakān //
column2: The doors of the sacrificial shed known as the doors of peace should be worshipped duly as before and also the wardergods located in the branches of the sacrificial trees by the performance of circumambulation.

column1: prāci nandimahākālau yāmye bhṛṅgivināyakau / vāruṇe vṛṣabhaskandau devīcaṇḍau tatottare //
column2: The wardergods Nandi and Mahākāla should be worshipped at the east, Bhṛgṅgi and Vināyaka at the south, Vṛṣabha and Skanda at the west, the warder goddess and Caṇḍa at the north of the sacrificial shed.

column1: tacchākhāmūladeśasthau praśāntaśiśirau ghaṭau / parjanyāśokanāmānau bhūtaṃ sañjīvanāmṛtau // dhanadaśrīpradau dvau dvau pūjayedanupūrvaśaḥ / svanāmabhiś caturthyantaiḥ praṇavādinamontagaiḥ //
column2: Then the preceptor should worship two pitchers each at the base of the branches of the sacrificial treespraśānta tranquil and śiśira cool, parjanya raincloud and aśoka griefless, sañjīvana reviving and amṛta ambrosia, dhanada bestower of wealth and śrīprada bestower of prosperity one after another with the repetition of their names ending in the fourth case preceded by the syllable Oṃ and ending with ‘obeisance’.

column1: lokagrahavasudvāḥsthasravantīnāṃ dvayaṃ dvayaṃ / bhānutrayaṃ yugaṃ vedo lakṣmīrgaṇapatis tathā // iti devāmakhāgāre tiṣṭhanti pratitoraṇaṃ /
column2: The worlds, planets, warder gods and rivers, two in each one of them, three suns, two Vedas, goddess Lakṣmī and lord Gaṇapati are the gods who stay in the sacrificial shed at each one of the doors for warding impediments and guarding the sacrifice.

column1: vajraṃ śaktiṃ tathā daṇḍaṃ khaḍgaṃ pāśaṃ dhvajaṃ gadāṃ / triśūlaṃ cakramambhojampatākāsvarcayet kramāt //
column2: The thunderbolt, spear, club, sword, noose, banner, mace, trident, disc and lotus should be duly worshipped in the banner with the mantras Oṃ hrīṃ phaṭ obeisance.

column1: kumudaḥ kumudākṣaś ca puṇḍarīkotha vāmanaḥ /
column2: Oṃ hrūṃ phaṭ to the spear at the door, hrūṃ phaṭ obeisance.

column1: śaṅkukarṇaḥ sarvanetraḥ sumukhaḥ supratiṣṭhitaḥ // dhvajāṣṭadevatāḥ pūjyāḥ pūrvādau bhūtakoṭibhiḥ /
column2: The eight presiding deities of the banner such as Kumuda, Kumudākṣa, Puṇḍarīka, Vāmana, Śaṅkukarṇa, Sarvanetra, Sumukha and Supratiṣṭhita should be worshipped in the east etc.

column1: oṃ kauṃ kumudāya nama ity ādimantraiḥ //
column2: with the offering of oblation to all beings and with the mantras oṃ kauṃ obeisance to Kumuda etc.

column1: hetukaṃ tripuraghnañca śaktyākhyaṃ yamajihvakaṃ / kālaṃ karālinaṃ ṣaṣṭhamekāṅghrimbhīmamaṣṭakaṃ // tathaiva pūjayed dikṣu kṣetrapālānanukramāt /
column2: In the same manner the eight guardian deities Hetuka, Tripuraghna, Śakti, Yamajihva, Kāla, Karālin, Ekāṅghri and Bhīma should be worshipped in the different directions with offerings, flowers and incense.

column1: balibhiḥ kusumair dhūpaiḥ santuṣṭān paribhāvayet //
column2: The preceptor should contemplate them as satisfied.

column1: kambalāstṛteṣu varṇeṣu vaṃśasthūṇāsvanukramāt / pañca kṣityāditattvāni sadyojātādibhiryajet //
column2: The five fundamental principles earth etc. should be worshipped in kakṣītṛṇa a kind of fragrant grass, bamboos, pillars and other things in order with the mantras sadyojāta etc.

column1: sadāśivapadavyāpi maṇḍapaṃ dhāma śāṅkaraṃ / patākāśaktisaṃyuktaṃ tattvadṛṣṭyāvalokayet //
column2: The preceptor should look at the sacrificial shed as permeated by the essence of god Sadāśiva, hallowed by his presence and endowed with the banners and spears in the form of fundamental principles.

column1: divyāntarikṣabhūmiṣṭhavighnānutsārya pūrvavat / praviśet paścimadvārā śeṣadvārāṇi darśayet //
column2: After having warded off the divine ethereal and earthly obstacles as laid down before, the preceptor should enter the shed through the western door and look at the other remaining doors.

column1: pradakṣiṇakramādgatvā niviṣṭovedidakṣiṇe / uttarābhimukhaḥ kuryād bhūtaśuddhiṃ yathā purā //
column2: After having walked around reverentially and seated on the southern side of the altar and remaining facing the north, one should perform the purification of elements as before.

column1: antaryāgaṃ viśeṣārghyaṃ mantradravyādiśodhanaṃ /
column2: Then the internal sacrifice, the purification of the mantras and the materials, and the worship of one’s own self should be done.

column1: kurvīta ātmanaḥ pūjāṃ pañcagavyādi pūrvavat //
column2: The five things got from a cow should be applied as before.

column1: sādhāraṅkalasantasmin vinyasettadanantaraṃ / viśeṣācchivatattvāya tattvatrayamanukramāt //
column2: Then the sacrificial pitcher should be placed therein along with the receptacle, especially for the principle of Śiva and the three fundamental principles soul, body and matter in order.

column1: lalāṭaskandhapādāntaṃ śivavidyātmakaṃ paraṃ / rudranārāyaṇabrahmadaivataṃ nijasañcaraiḥ //
column2: The preceptor should locate by means of his psychic force, the supreme principle of Śiva a long with the presiding deities Rudra, Nārāyaṇa and Brahmā in his body from the forehead and trunk to the foot.

column1: mūrtīstadīśvarāṃstatra pūrvavadviniveśayet / tadvyāpakaṃ śivaṃ sāṅgaṃ śivahastañca mūrdhani //
column2: Oṃ, haṃ, hāṃ, The images of the god and their presiding deities should be located therein as before and contemplate himself as covered by the essence of Śiva along with his constituent members and forearm of Śiva on his head.

column1: brahmarandhrapraviṣṭena tejasā vāhyasāntaraṃ / tamaḥpaṭalamādhūya pradyotitadigantaraṃ // ātmānaṃ mūrtipaiḥ sārdhaṃ sragvastrakusumādibhiḥ / bhūṣayitvā śivosmīti dhyātvā boghāsimuddharet //
column2: The preceptor should then contemplate the effulgence of Śiva which has permeated his body and which has entered the cavity of the brain as coming out dispelling darkness and illuminating the interspace between directions. Having decked himself with flowers, garlands and cloth along with the custodians of deities the preceptor should contemplate as “ am Śiva” and draw out the sword of knowledge.

column1: catuṣpadāntasaṃskāraiḥ saṃskuryānmakhamaṇḍapaṃ /
column2: The sacrificial shed should be purified with the fourfold rites of purification.

column1: vikṣipya vikirādīni kuśakūrcopasaṃharet //
column2: After having scattered the kuśa all around, they should again be gathered.

column1: āsanīkṛtya vardhanyāṃ vāstvādīn pūrvavadyajet /
column2: in the big pitcher vardhanī as before, the preceptor should worship them.

column1: śivakumbhāstravardhanyau pūjayecca sthirāsane //
column2: The pitcher sacred to god Śiva and the weapons and the vardhanī pitcher should be worshipped in the fixed seat.

column1: svadikṣu kalaśārūḍhāṃllokapālānanukramāt / vāhāyudhādisaṃyuktān pūjayedvidhinā yathā //
column2: Then the guardian deities of the worlds along with their weapons and vehicles should be worshipped in order in the pitchers situated at the different directions as laid down.

column1: airāvatagajārūḍhaṃ svarṇavarṇaṃ kirīṭinaṃ / sahasranayanaṃ śakraṃ vajrapāṇiṃ vibhāvayet //
column2: The preceptor should contemplate god Indra as having a golden complexion, thousand eyes, wearing the crown, and wielding the thunderbolt.

column1: saptārciṣaṃ ca vibhrāṇamakṣamālāṃ kamaṇḍaluṃ / jvālāmālākulaṃ raktaṃ śaktihastamajāsanaṃ //
column2: God Saptārcis Fire god should be contemplated as holding a rosary, kamaṇḍalu a small water pitcher, and a spear in the hand, red in complexion, engulfed by garland of flames and as riding the goat.

column1: mahiṣasthaṃ daṇḍahastaṃ yamaṃ kālānalaṃ smaret / raktanetraṃ svarārūḍhaṃ khaḍgahastañca nairṛtaṃ //
column2: God Yama god of death should be remembered as riding a buffalo, carrying a club in his hand and of the form of destructive fire and lord Nirṛti as riding an ass, carrying a sword in the hand and having red eyes.

column1: varuṇaṃ makare śvetaṃ nāgapāśadharaṃ smaret / vāyuṃ ca hariṇe nīlaṃ kuveraṃ meghasaṃsthitaṃ //
column2: The preceptor should then meditate lord Varuṇa as seated on a crocodile and having white complexion holding a noose of serpent in his hand and lord Vāyu wind god as riding an antelope and having blue complexion and Kubera god of wealth as seated on a sheep.

column1: triśūlinaṃ vṛṣe ceśaṃ kūrmenantantu cakriṇaṃ / brāhmāṇaṃ haṃsagaṃ dhyāyeccaturvaktraṃ caturbhujaṃ //
column2: Lord Īśa Śiva, the tridentbearer should be contemplated as seated on a bull, god Ananta, the discbearer as seated on a tortoise, and lord Brahmā, the fourfaced and fourarmed as riding a gander.

column1: stambhamūleṣu kumbheṣu vedyāṃ dharmādikān yajet /
column2: Lord Dharma god of virtue and others should be worshipped in the pitchers located at the base of the pillars at the corners.

column1: dikṣu kumbheṣvanantādīn pūjayantyapi kecana //
column2: Some also worship the gods Ananta and others in the pitchers placed at the corners of different directions.

column1: śivājñāṃ śrāvayet kumbhaṃ bhrāmayedātmapṛṣṭhagaṃ /
column2: The injunction of lord Śiva should be made to be heard. The pitcher placed behind one’s own selfshould be gently turned around.

column1: pūrvavat sthāpayedādau kumbhaṃ tadanu vardhanīṃ //
column2: Then as before the pitcher should be firmly put first and then the pitcher vardhanī.

column1: śivaṃ sthirāsanaṃ kumbhe śastrārthañca dhruvāsanaṃ / pūjayitvā yathāpūrvaṃ spṛśedudbhavamudrayā //
column2: After having worshipped lord Śiva seated in a firm seat and again in a firm seat for the sake of weapons, the preceptor should as before touch with the udbhavamudrā posture made with the fingers denoting generation.

column1: nijayāgaṃ jagannātha rakṣa bhaktānukampayā /
column2: “O lord of the universe you protect this sacrifice of thy own self out of compassion for the devotee”.

column1: ebhiḥ saṃśrāvya rakṣārthaṃ kumbhe khaḍgaṃ niveśayet //
column2: After having addressed these words, the preceptor should place the sword in the pitcher.

column1: dīkṣāsthāpanayoḥ kumbhe sthaṇḍile maṇḍale 'thavā / maṇḍalebhyarcya deveśaṃ vrajedvai kuṇḍasannidhau // kuṇḍanābhiṃ puraskṛtya niniṣṭhā mūrtidhāriṇaḥ /
column2: After having worshipped the lord in the pitcher or on the ground or in the shed relating to initiation and establishment, the preceptor should go in front of the firereceptacle. The custodians of images who are seated in front of the centre of the pit should purify the respective pits as directed by the preceptor.

column1: japeyurjāpinaḥ saṅkhyaṃ mantramanye tu saṃhitāṃ /
column2: The reciters of mantras should recite the mantras as many times as laid down. Others should recite the saṃhitā mantra.

column1: paṭheyurbrāhmaṇāḥ śāntiṃ svaśākhāvedapāragāḥ //
column2: The brahmins, wellversed in their respective branches should read the appeasing mantras.

column1: śrīsūktaṃ pāvamānīś ca maitrakañca vṛṣākapiṃ / ṛgvedī sarvadigbhāge sarvametat samuccaret //
column2: A follower of the Ṛgveda should recite the hymns śrīsūkta, pāvamānī, maitraka and vṛṣākapi on the east.

column1: devavratantu bhāruṇḍaṃ jyeṣṭhasāma rathantaraṃ /
column2: A follower of Sāmaveda should recite the hymnsdevavrata, bhāruṇḍa, jyeṣṭha and rathantara on the south.

column1: rudraṃ puruṣasūktañca ślokādhyāyaṃ viśeṣataḥ / brāhmaṇañca yajurvedī paścimāyāṃ samuccaret //
column2: A follower of Yajurveda should recite the hymns rudra, puruṣasūkta, ślokādhyāya especially and the brāhmaṇas in the west.

column1: nīlarudraṃ tathātharvī sūkṣmāsūkṣmantathaiva ca /
column2: An Atharvavedin should repeat the hynnsnīlarudra, sūkṣmāsūkṣma and the atharvaśīrṣa in the north.

column1: ācāryaścāgnimutpādya pratikuṇḍaṃ pradāpayet / vahneḥ pūrvādikān bhāgān pūrvakuṇḍāditaḥ kramāt //
column2: After having ignited the sacrificial fire, the preceptor should fill the eastern part of each one of the pit from the east in order.

column1: dhūpadīpacarūṇāñca dadītāgniṃ samuddharet /
column2: Incense, lamps and sacrificial porridge should be offered to them. Then the fire should be offered.

column1: pūrvavacchivamabhyarcya śivāgnau mantratarpaṇaṃ //
column2: After having worshipped Śiva as before, offering unto fire should be made accompanied by the chanting of mantra.

column1: deśakālādisampattau dur nimittapraśāntaye / homaṅkṛtvā tu mantrajñaḥ pūrṇāṃ dattvā śubhāvahāṃ //
column2: After having made the oblation for making the place and time of the sacrifice as auspicious and to ward off omens portending evil, the knower of mantras should offer the final oblation which brings forth good.

column1: pūrvavaccarukaṃ kṛtvā pratikuṇḍaṃ nivedayet /
column2: After having prepared the sacrificial porridge as before, it should be offered to each one of the pit.

column1: yajamānālaṅkṛtāstu vrajeyuḥ snānamaṇḍapaṃ //
column2: Then the yajamānas persons at whose instance a ceremony is performed should go to the bathing shed welladorned.

column1: bhadrapīṭhe nidhāyeśaṃ tāḍayitvāvaguṇṭhayet /
column2: The image of the god should be placed on the auspicious seat and covered with the essence of the mantra after gently stroking it.

column1: snāpayet pūjayitvā tu mṛdā kāṣāyavāriṇā // gomūtrair gomayenāpi vāriṇā cāntarāntarā / bhasmanā gandhatoyena phaḍantāstreṇa vāriṇā //
column2: After having worshipped, it should be bathed with mud and herbal waters. The image should be bathed in between with the urine of a cow and cowdung, sacred as and perfumed water with the recitation of the mantra of the weapon ending with the syllable phaṭ.

column1: deśiko mūrtipaiḥ sārdhaṃ kṛtvā kāraṇaśodhanaṃ / dharmajaptena sañchāṭya pītavarṇena vāsasā //
column2: The preceptor, after having purified the casual principles, should cover the image with a yellow coloured cloth sanctified by the repetition of the dharma mantra in the company of the protectors of the image.

column1: sampūjya sitapuṣpaiś ca nayeduttaravedikāṃ / tatra dattāsanāyāñca śayyāyāṃ sanniveśya ca //
column2: After having worshipped the image with white flowers it should be carried to the sacrificial platform at the north.

column1: kuṅkumāliptasūtreṇa vibhajya gururālikhet / śalākayā suvarṇasya akṣiṇī śastrakarmaṇā // añjayellakṣmakṛt paścācchāstradṛṣṭena karmaṇā / kṛtakarmā ca śastreṇa lakṣmī śilpī samutkṣipet //
column2: After having laid the image on a seat placed over the bed, the preceptor should mark on the image with lines of saffronsmeared strings and mark the position of the eyes with a golden stick. The collyrium should be put on the eyelids and then the sculptor should carve out the eyes with an implement at the spot as laid down in the technical works.

column1: tryaṃśādardhotha pādārdhādardhāyā / sarvakāmaprasiddhyarthaṃ śubhaṃ lakṣmāvatāraṇaṃ //
column2: The eyes should be carved into a spot just at half of one third or half of one fourth or half of half the length, for accomplishing all desires and it is auspicious.

column1: liṅgadīrghavikārāṃśe tribhaktaṃ bhāgavarṇanāt / vistāro lakṣma dehasya bhavelliṅgasya sarvataḥ //
column2: Taking onefourth part of the length of the liṅga and having divided it into three parts, one such part should always be the breadth of the body.

column1: yavasya navabhaktasya bhāgair aṣṭābhirāvṛtā / hastike lakṣmarekhā ca gāmbhīryād vistarādapi // evamaṣṭāṃśavṛddhyā tu liṅge sārdhakarādike /
column2: In the liṅga of a cubit length, the cavity of the eyes should be a ninth part of one eighth of a yava measure both in depth and breadth. In the liṅga of one and a half cubit length, the sockets of the eyes would measure an eighth part of a yava measure more than that of the preceding.

column1: evamaṣṭāṃśa vṛddhyā tu liṅge sārdhakarādike /
column2: In that the liṅga of a cubit length the cavity of the eyes would be eight yava measure in depth and breadth.

column1: śāmbhaveṣu ca liṅgeṣu pādavṛddheṣu sarvataḥ / lakṣma dehasya viṣkambho bhavedvai yavavardhanāt //
column2: In all the liṅgas of Śambhu lord Śiva where the length would increase by the pāda measure, the measures of the cavities of the eyes would also correspondingly increase by a yava measure.

column1: gambhīratvaṣṭayuvābhyāṃ rekhāpi tryaṃśavṛddhitaḥ /
column2: The lines on the top of the liṅga would also increase by three parts both in depth and breadth.

column1: sarveṣu ca bhavet sūkṣmāṃ liṅgamastakamastakaṃ //
column2: In all the cases the top of the liṅga would be narrow and tapering.

column1: lakṣmakṣetreṣṭadhābhakte mūrdhnibhāgadvaye śubhe / ṣaḍbhāgaparivartanamuktvā bhāgadvayantvadhaḥ // rekhātrayeṇa sambaddhaṃ kārayet pṛṣṭadeśagaṃ /
column2: The region of the eyes should be divided into eight parts and the lower part of the head into two. The two lower parts of the region of the eyes should be left out. The remaining six parts should be carved into three lines taken round and joined at the back of the emblem.

column1: ratnaje lakṣaṇoddhāro yavau hemasamudbhave //
column2: The line at the top should be made to measure ayava measure in the case of a liṅga made of gem as well as of gold.

column1: svarūpaṃ lakṣaṇanteṣāṃ prabhā ratneṣu nirmalā /
column2: The form and characteristic features of these are that the radiance of those made of gem is spotless.

column1: nayanonmīlanaṃ vaktre sānnidhyāya ca lakṣma tat // lakṣmaṇoddhārarekhāñca ghṛtena madhunā tathā / mṛtyuñjayena sampūjya śilpidoṣanivṛttaye // arcayecca tato liṅgaṃ snāpayitvā mṛdādibhiḥ /
column2: The emblem should be endowed with the eyesight by carving the above mark into the part indicated above. After having worshipped the lines bringing out the characteristic features of the emblem with ghee and honey with the repetition of the mṛtyuñjayamantra in order to remove the defects due to the sculptor, the liṅga should then be worshipped after having bathed it with mud and other things.

column1: śilpinantoṣayitvā tu dadyādgāṃ gurave tataḥ //
column2: After having gratified the sculptor, a cow should be given to the preceptor.

column1: liṅgaṃ dhūpādibhiḥ prācyaṃ gāyeyurbhartṛgāstrayaḥ /
column2: After having worshipped the liṅga with incense and other things, married women should sing in praise of the lord.

column1: smṛtvā ca rocanaṃ datvā kuryānnirmañjanādikaṃ / guḍalavaṇadhānyākadānena visṛjecca tāḥ //
column2: After having touched the liṅga on the left and right with the string or with the kuśa, and rubbing with rocana pigment, the women should be sent away after giving gifts of molasses, salt and brains.

column1: gurumūrtidharaiḥ sārdhaṃ hṛdā vā praṇavena vā / mṛtsnāgomayagomūtrabhasmabhiḥ salilāntaraṃ //
column2: The preceptor along with the custodians of idols should bathe the liṅga with mud, cowdung, cow’s urine, ashes and water with the recitation of hṛdayamantra or praṇava.

column1: snāpayet pañcagavyena pañcāmṛtapuraḥsaraṃ /
column2: Then it should be bathed with the five things got from a cow preceded by bathing with the five sweet things.

column1: virūkṣaṇaṃ kaṣāyaiś ca sarvauṣadhijalena vā //
column2: After the smearing of decoctions of herbs it should be bathed with all herbal waters.

column1: śubhrapuṣpaphalasvarṇaratnaśṛṅgayavodakaiḥ /
column2: Then it should be bathed with waters mixed with white flowers, fruits, gold, gems, horn and barley.

column1: tathā dhārāsahasreṇa divyauṣadhijalena ca //
column2: Then it should be bathed with thousand pourings of divine herbal waters.

column1: tīrthodakena gāṅgena candanena ca vāriṇā / kṣīrārṇavādibhiḥ kumbhaiḥ śivakumbhajalena ca //
column2: Subsequently, the liṅga should be bathed with sacred waters, waters of river Ganges, waters mixed with sandal and from the pitcher representing milky ocean and that pitcher of water sacred to lord Śiva.

column1: virūkṣaṇaṃ vilepañca sugandhaiś candanādibhiḥ /
column2: Rubbing and besmearing should be done with fragrant sandal and other things.

column1: bhujyate tat piśācādyai rogādyaiḥ paribhūyate /

column2: The cities protected by deities confer victory, enjoyment and emancipation.

column2: The treasurehouse should be in the east, the kitchen in the southeast, the bedchamber in the south and the arsenal on the west. The dining chamber should be in the western part, the granary in the northwest, storehouse in the north and the chamber for the deities in the northeast.

column1: viśvajyotiḥpradhānāste bhāratantair vivardhitaṃ //
column2: They were the lights of the universe. The country of Bhārata was welldeveloped by them.

column1: kṛtatretādisargeṇa sargaḥ svāyambhuvaḥ smṛtaḥ /

column1: kuśaḥ krauñcas tathā śākaḥ puṣkaraśceti saptamaḥ //
column2: The seven continents are Jambū, Plakṣa, Śālmali, Kuśa, Krauñca, Śāka and Puṣkara.

column1: sarveṣveteṣu varṣeṣu sapta sapta kulācalāḥ //

column1: nadyaś ca śataśastebhyastīrthabhūtāḥ prajajñire /

column2: shall describe the sacred spots situated in Bhārata.

column2: See ib. . shall describe the greatness of all sacred spots which confer enjoyment and emancipation.

column2: The gods Viṣṇu and others dwell there. One who lives therein reaches lord Viṣṇu.

column1: sarasvatyāṃ sannihityāṃ snānakṛdbrahmalokabhāk //

column1: tac chrutvā sasuro brahmā gayāsuramathābravīt /

column1: etasminnantare brahmā munau supte tathāgataḥ //

column1: adoṣāhaṃ yatastvaṃ hi śāpaṃ prāpsyasi śaṅkarāt /

column2: Devavratā said, “If you are pleased with me, may Brahmā, Viṣṇu, Rudra, Gaurī, Lakṣmī and other gods stay in me ever.” The firegod said, “Having heard the words of Devavratā, the celestials said in affirmative and repaired to the heavens.”

column1: pañcakrośaṃ gayākṣetraṃ pañcāśat pañca cārpayet //
column2: The sacred place of Gayā extends to five krośas ten miles.

column1: grāmān svarṇagirīn kṛtvā nadīrdugdhamadhuśravāḥ / sarovarāṇi dadhyājyair bahūnannādiparvatān // kāmadhenuṃ kalpataruṃ svarṇarūpyagṛhāṇi ca /
column2: Fiftyfive villages were endowed with the following Golden hills flowing with rivers, milk and honey, reservoirs of curd, clarified butter, plenty of hills of food, kāmadhenu the celestial cow, kalpataru the celestial tree and abodes made of gold and silver.

column1: na yācayantu viprendrā alpānuktvā dadau prabhuḥ //
column2: Let the brahmins here do not seek alms. The lord gave all these things after having spoken very little.

column1: dharmayāge pralobhāttu pratigṛhya dhanādikaṃ / sthitā yadā gayāyānte śaptāte brahmaṇā tadā //
column2: The brahmins at Gayā were cursed by lord Brahmā when they on account of their greed received gifts of money and other things of the righteous sacrifice “You will be deprived of learning.

column1: vidyāvivarjitā yūyaṃ tṛṣṇāyuktā bhaviṣyatha /
column2: You will be greedy.

column1: dugdhādivarjitā nadyaḥ śailāḥ pāṣāṇarūpiṇaḥ //
column2: The rivers will be bereft of milk and other things. The mountains will become mere rocks.”

column1: brahmāṇaṃ brāhmaṇaścocur naṣṭaṃ śāpena śākhilaṃ /

column1: ye yuṣmān pūjayiṣyanti gayāyāmāgatā narāḥ //
column2: The people who come to Gayā and worship you by offering gifts of food, wealth etc.

column1: havyakavyair dhanaiḥ śraddhaisteṣāṃ kulaśataṃ vrajet / narakāt svargalokāya svargalokāt parāṅgatiṃ //
column2: and ancestral rights shall elevate hundreds of their families to heaven from hell and excellent position after heaven.”

column1: gayopi cākarodyāgaṃ bahvannaṃ bahudakṣiṇaṃ /

column1: gayā purī tena nāmnā pāṇḍavā ījire hariṃ //
column2: The place has been named as Gayā after him. The Pāṇḍavas worshipped lord Viṣṇu.

column2: What is that to be done by acquiring knowledge about the brahman the absolute? What is the benefit of dying at a cowshed? What is the use of stay at Kurukṣetra? If the son goes to Gayā, the ancestors celebrate it on seeing that the son has reached Gayā.

column1: brahmajñānaṃ gayāśrāddhaṃ gogṛhe maraṇaṃ tathā // vāsaḥ puṃsāṃ kurukṣetre muktireṣā caturvidhā / kāṅkṣanti pitaraḥ putraṃ narakādbhayabhīravaḥ //
column2: They would think, will they the sons offer us waters at least by touching with their feet? The knowledge about brahman, the ancestral rite at Gayā, the death at the cowshed and stay at Kurukṣetra are the four ways of attaining liberation.

column1: gayāṃ yāsyati yaḥ putraḥ sa nastrātā bhaviṣyati /

column1: muṇḍanañcopavāsaś ca sarvatīrtheṣvayaṃ vidhiḥ //

column1: na kālādirgayātīrthe dadyāt piṇḍāṃś ca nityaśaḥ /

column1: pakṣatrayanivāsī ca punātyāsaptatamaṃ kulaṃ //

column1: pitrādinavadaityaṃ tathā dvādaśadaivataṃ /
column2: So also with the rites for the nine relatives such as the father etc. and for the twelve relatives.

column1: prathame divase snāyāttīrthe hy uttaramānase //
column2: One should bathe in the sacred water of Uttaramānasa on the first day.

column2: One should bathe in the sacred Uttaramānasa for the sake of increase of longevity and good health, for the destruction of all sins and for liberation.

column2: One should satisfy beings in heaven, sky and earth, and father and mother with the words, “ make these offerings of balls of rice for my father, grandfather, greatgrandfather, mother, paternal grandmother, paternal greatgrandfather, maternal grandfather, maternal greatgrandfather and maternal great great grandfather and others for their uplift.

column1: oṃ namaḥ sūryadevāya somabhaumajñarūpiṇe // jīvaśukraśanaiścārirāhuketusvarūpiṇe /
column2: “Our salutations to the Sungod who is of the forms of the planets Moon, Mars, Mercury, Jupiter, Venus, Saturn, Rāhu and Ketu.

column1: uttare mānase snātā uddharetsakalaṃ kulaṃ //
column2: Whoever bathes in the Uttaramānasa elevates his entire family.

column1: sūryaṃ natvā vrajenmaunī naro dakṣiṇamānasaṃ /
column2: After having saluted Sun god one should go to the Dakṣiṇamānasa without speaking any word.

column1: dakṣiṇe mānase snānaṃ karomi pitṛtṛptaye //
column2: One should contemplate as follows “ bathe in the Dakṣiṇamānasa for the satisfaction of my ancestors.

column1: gayāyāmāgataḥ svargaṃ yāntu me pitaro 'khilāḥ / śrāddhaṃ piṇḍantataḥ kṛtvā sūryaṃ natvā vadedidaṃ //
column2: have come to Gayā. May all my ancestors ascend heaven.” After having performed ancestral rite and offered balls of rice, one should utter as follows after worshipping Sun god

column1: oṃ namo bhānave bhartre bhavāya bhava me vibho / bhuktimuktipradaḥ sarvapitṝṇāṃ bhavabhāvitaḥ //
column2: O Supreme god! get me the cherished end. Graciously grant enjoyment and emancipation to all my ancestors.

column1: madīyāḥ pitaro ye ca mātṛmātāmahādayaḥ //
column2: My ancestors such as mother, maternal grandfather and others were protected here by all of you.

column1: teṣāṃ piṇḍapradātāhamāgato 'smi gayāmimāṃ /
column2: am the person to offer them balls of rice. have come to this Gayā Kṣetra.

column1: udīcyāṃ muṇḍapṛṣṭhasya devarṣigaṇapūjitaṃ // nāmnā kanakhalaṃ tīrthaṃ triṣu lokeṣu viśrutaṃ /
column2: The sacred place named Kanakhala, renowned in three worlds and being worshipped by celestials, sages and gaṇas, lies to the north of Muṇḍapṛṣṭha the place where tonsure is done.

column2: The mortals on earth go to heavens and sport there by bathing there in the waters of Kanakhala.

column2: Then one should go to Phalgutīrtha situated on the Mahānadī after having visited Uttaramānasa, Nāga, Janārdana, sacred well and banyan tree.

column2: This is spoken as the Gayāśira. It is also called Phalgutīrtha.

column1: yasmin phalati śrīrgaurvā kāmadhenurjalaṃ mahī /

column2: The sacred places on earth, commencing with oceans and ending with tanks go to Phalgutīrtha once everyday.

column1: snātvā śrāddhī piṇḍado 'tha nameddevaṃ pitāmahaṃ /

column1: kalau māheśvarā lokā atra devī gadādharaḥ //
column2: In this Kaliyuga, all regions of the universe are presided over by lord Maheśvara Śiva.

column1: pitāmaho liṅgarūpī tannamāmi maheśvaraṃ /

column2: One should say, “ make obeisance to lords Maheśvara Śiva, Gadādhara Viṣṇu, Bala, Kāma god of love, Aniruddha a form of Viṣṇu and Nārāyaṇa. also make obeisance to Brahmā, Viṣṇu, Nṛsiṃha and Varāha forms of Viṣṇu and others.” Then one elevates hundreds of his family after worshipping lord Gadādhara.

column2: One should utter the following words, after worshipping gods Mataṅgeśa and Siddheśa “Let the gods and guardian deities be the witness to the fact that had come here and performed rites at this Mataṅga for the liberation of my forefathers.

column1: mahābodhaturuṃ natvā dharmavān svargalokabhāk //

column1: tarpaṇaṃ śrāddhakṛt piṇḍaṃ pradadyāttu prasecanaṃ /

column1: kuryācca vājapeyārthī brahmayūpapradakṣiṇaṃ //

column1: eko muniḥ kumbhakuśāgrahasta āmrasya mūle salilandadāti /

column1: āmnāya siktāḥ pitaraś ca tṛptā ekā kriyā dvyarthakarī prasiddhā //
column2: The mango trees are watered and the forefathers are satisfied. One act is well known as yielding two fruits.

column1: brahmāṇañca namaskṛtya kulānāṃ śatamuddharet /

column1: tatra piṇḍapradānena kulānāṃ śatamudharet /
column2: By offering balls of rice there, one elevates hundreds of generations.

column1: muṇḍapṛṣṭhe padaṃ nnyāstaṃ mahādevena dhīmatā // muṇḍapṛṣṭhe śiraḥ sākṣād gayāśira udāhṛtaṃ /
column2: The great lord Mahādeva Śiva has placed his foot at the Muṇḍapṛṣṭha. The Gayāśira is said to be the sanctuary at Muṇḍapṛṣṭha.

column1: sākṣād gayāśirastatra phalgutīrthāśramaṃ kṛtaṃ //

column1: amṛtaṃ tatra vahati pitṝṇāndattamakṣayaṃ /

column1: pitrādīnāṃ śatakulaṃ svātmānaṃ tārayennaraḥ //
column2: One will elevate hundreds of forefathers as also his own self.

column1: pretaiḥ sarvaiḥ sahārtaḥ san sukṛtaṃ bhujyate phalaṃ //

column1: dhanaṃ gṛhītvā me gaccha gayāyāṃ piṇḍado bhava / vaṇigdhanaṃ gṛhītvā tu gayāyāṃ piṇḍado 'bhavat //
column2: You go to Gayā with money and offer us balls of rice”. The merchant went to Gayā with money and offered balls of rice.

column1: pretarājaḥ saha pretair mukto nīto hareḥ puraṃ /

column1: ye kecit pretarūpeṇa tiṣṭhanti pitaro mama / te sarve tṛptimāyāntu piṇḍadānena sarvadā //
column2: Those forefathers of mine who remain in the form of a preta, let all of them be pleased for ever by the offer of the ball of rice”.

column1: piṇḍo deyastu sarvebhyaḥ sarvair vai kulatārakaiḥ /
column2: All those who desire to elevate the family should offer balls of rice to all.

column1: ātmanastu tathā deyo hy akṣayaṃ lokamicchatā //
column2: So also one desirous of elevating his own self and getting imperishable place should offer ball of rice.

column1: pañcame 'hni gadālole snāyānmantreṇa buddhimān /
column2: The wise man should bathe at Gadālola with the repetition of mantras.

column1: gadāprakṣālane tīrthe gadālole 'tipāvane // snānaṃ karāmi saṃsāragadaśāntyai janārdana /
column2: O lord Janārdana! bathe in this sacred Gadāprakṣālana at the extremely sacred Gadālola in order to appease sufferings due to mundane existence.

column1: namo 'kṣayavaṭāyaiva akṣayasvargadāyine //
column2: Obeisance to the Akṣayavaṭa banyan tree, which yields undecaying heaven.

column1: pitrādīnāmakṣayāya sarvapāpakṣayāya ca / śrāddhaṃ vaṭatale kuryād brāhmaṇānāñca bhojanaṃ //
column2: One should do the ancestral rite at the spot of the banyan tree and feed brahmins for securing undecaying position of forefathers and for the destruction of all sins.

column1: ekasmin bhojite vipre koṭirbhavati bhojitā /
column2: If one brahmin has been fed, crores of brahmins would become fed.

column1: kimpunarbahubhirbhuktaiḥ pitṝṇāṃ dattamakṣayaṃ //
column2: What more to say? If many are fed, the offerings done to the forefathers become undecaying.

column1: gayāyāmannadātā yaḥ pitarastena putriṇaḥ /
column2: The fathers of those who offer food at Gayā become virtually the putriṇa i.e. having sons.

column1: vaṭaṃ vaṭeśvaraṃ natvā pūjayet prapitāmahaṃ //
column2: After having saluted the banyan tree and the lord of the banyan tree, one should worship the great grandfather.

column1: akṣayāṃllabhate lokān kulānāṃ śatamuddharet /
column2: One would attain imperishable position and elevate hundreds of his family members.

column1: kramato 'kramato vāpi gayāyatrā mahāphalā //
column2: The pilgrimage made to Gayā always bears fruit whether it is done in the proper way or not.

column1: gāyatryaiva mahānadyāṃ snātaḥ sandhyāṃ samācaret /
column2: One should do sandhyā twilight worship after bathing in the river Mahānadī with the recitation of gāyatrī mantra.

column1: gāyatryā agrataḥ prātaḥ śrāddhaṃ piṇḍamathākṣayaṃ //
column2: The ancestral rite and offer of balls of rice in the morning preceded by the recitation of gāyatrī mantra yields undiminishing fruits.

column1: madhyāhne codyati snātvā gītavādyair hyupāsya ca / sāvitrīpurataḥ sandhyāṃ piṇḍadānañca tatpade //
column2: Having bathed in the noon as the sun remains up and having worshipped with songs and playing of musical instruments, the evening twilight worship is done there itself in front of the sun and the offer of balls of rice is made.

column1: agastyasya pade kuryādyonidvāraṃ praviśya ca / nirgato na punaryoniṃ praviśenmucyate bhavāt //
column2: One, who has come out after having entered the yonidvāra the fissure in the hill, does not enter the yoni the womb again and will be liberated from the cycles of birth and death.

column1: baliṃ kākaśilāyāñca kumārañca namettataḥ / svargadvāryāṃ somakuṇḍe vāyutīrthe 'tha piṇḍadaḥ //
column2: He should then pay obeisance to Bali a demon king at Kākaśilā and lord Kumāra Subrahmaṇya.Then one should offer balls of rice at Svargadvāra, Somakuṇḍa and Vāyutīrtha.

column1: bhavedākaśagaṅgāyāṃ kapilāyāñca piṇḍadaḥ /
column2: Then he should offer balls of rice at Ākāśagaṅgā and Kapila.

column1: kapileśaṃ śivaṃ natvā rukmikuṇḍe ca piṇḍadaḥ //
column2: After having paid obeisance to Śiva, the lord of Kapilā, one should offer balls of rice at Rukmikuṇḍa.

column1: koṭītīrthe ca koṭīśaṃ natvāmoghapade naraḥ /
column2: After having worshipped lord Koṭīśa at Koṭitīrtha, one should offer balls of rice at Amoghapada.

column1: gadālole vānarake gopracāre ca piṇḍadaḥ //
column2: Then the balls of rice should be offered at Gadālola, Vānaraka and Gopracāra.

column1: natvā gāvaṃ vaitaraṇyāmekaviṃśakuloddhṛtiḥ /
column2: After the worship of the cow, one who does the ancestral rite and offers balls of rice at the river Vaitariṇī, elevates twentyone generations.

column1: śrāddhapiṇḍapradātā syāt krauñcapade ca piṇḍadaḥ //
column2: Then one should offer balls of rice at Krauñcapāda.

column1: tṛtīyāyāṃ viśālāyāṃ niścirāyāñca piṇḍadaḥ /
column2: The pilgrim should then offer balls of rice at Viśālā and Niścirā on the third day.

column1: ṛṇamokṣe pāpamokṣe bhasmakuṇḍe 'tha bhasmanā // snānakṛn mucyate pāpānnameddevaṃ janārdanam /
column2: One who bathes in the Ṛṇamokṣa and Pāpamokṣa and with the sacred ash at the Bhasmakuṇḍa gets free from sin.

column1: eṣa piṇḍo mayā dattastava haste janārdana //
column2: One should then worship lord Janārdana uttering as follows “ have placed this ball of rice on your hand.

column1: gayāyāṃ pitṛrūpeṇa svayameva janārdanaḥ //
column2: O Janārdana! When die let this remain without decay.” Lord Janārdana himself remains at Gayā in the form of forefathers.

column1: taṃ dṛṣṭvā puṇḍarīkākṣaṃ mucyate vai ṛṇatrayāt /
column2: Having worshipped that lotuseyed lord one gets liberated from three debts.

column1: mārkaṇḍeyeśvaraṃ natvā namedgṛdhreśvaraṃ naraḥ //
column2: After having worshipped lord Mārkaṇḍeyeśvara, one should worship lord Gṛdhreśvara.

column1: mūlakṣetre maheśasya dhārāyāṃ piṇḍado bhavet /
column2: Then the balls of rice should be offered to lord Maheśa at the Mūlakṣetra at Dhārā.

column1: gṛdhrakūṭe gṛdhravaṭe dhautapāde ca piṇḍadaḥ //
column2: Balls of rice should be offered at Gṛdhrakūṭa, Gṛdhravaṭa and Dhautapāda.

column1: puṣkariṇyāṃ kardamāle rāmatīrthe ca piṇḍadaḥ /
column2: The pilgrim should then offer balls of rice at the Puṣkariṇī, Kardamāla and Rāmatīrtha.

column1: prabhāseśannamet pretaśilāyāṃ piṇḍado bhavet //
column2: One should make obeisance to lord Prabhāseśa and offer piṇḍa balls of rice at Pretaśilā.

column1: divyāntarīkṣabhūmiṣṭhāḥ pitaro bāndhavādayaḥ / pretādirūpā muktāḥ syuḥ piṇḍair dattair mayākhilāḥ //
column2: The following words should be recited on these occasions “May all my forefathers and relatives who are still in the form of pretas the dead people still in the state of a spirit in the heavens, sky or earth get released from that state by my offer of piṇḍas.”

column1: sthānatraye pretaśilā gayāśirasi pāvanī / prabhāse pretakuṇḍe ca piṇḍadastārayet kulam //
column2: One who offers piṇḍa at the following three placesPretaśilā, the sacred Gayāśiras and Pretakuṇḍa at Prabhāsa, liberates his family.

column1: vasiṣṭheśannamaskṛtya tadagre piṇḍado bhavet /
column2: The pilgrim should pay obeisance to lord Vasiṣṭheśa and offer piṇḍa in front of that deity.

column1: gayānābhau suṣumṇāyāṃ mahākoṣṭyāñca piṇḍadaḥ //
column2: He should then offer piṇḍa at Gayānābhi, Suṣumṇā and Mahākoṭi.

column1: gadādharāgrato muṇḍapṛṣṭhe devyāś ca sannidhau / muṇdapṛṣṭhaṃ namedādau kṣetrapālādisaṃyutam //
column2: Piṇḍa should be offered in front of lord Gadādhara, at Muṇḍapṛṣṭha and in the presence of the goddess. The Muṇḍapṛṣṭha together with the guardian deities should be worshipped first.

column1: pūjayitvā bhayaṃ na syādviṣarogādināśanam /
column2: By doing such worship, one will not have fear and the effects of disease and poison will be destroyed.

column1: brahmāṇañca namaskṛtya brahmalokaṃ nayet kulam //
column2: One who worships lord Brahmā conveys his family to the region of Bralunā.

column1: subhadrāṃ balabhadrañca prapūjya puruṣottamam / sarvakāmasamāyuktaḥ kulamuddhṛtya nākabhāk //
column2: One who worships Subhadrā sister of lord Kṛṣṇa, Balabhadra brother of lord Kṛṣṇa and Puruṣottama here refers to lord Kṛṣṇa, gets all his desires fulfilled, elevates his family and attains heaven.

column1: hṛṣīkeśaṃ namaskṛtya tadagre piṇḍado bhavet /
column2: One should pay obeisance to lord Hṛṣīkeśa and offer piṇḍa in front of that deity.

column1: mādhavaṃ pūjayitvā ca devo vaimāniko bhavet //
column2: Having worshipped lord Madhava, one becomes honoured by the celestials.

column1: mahālakṣmīṃ prārcya gaurīṃ maṅgalāñca sarasvatīm / pitṝnuddhṛtya svargastho bhuktabhogo 'tra śāstradhīḥ //
column2: One who worships the goddesses Mahālakṣmi, Gaurī, Maṅgalā and Sarasvatī elevates his forefathers and enjoys all pleasures in heaven and becomes a learned man in his next birth.

column1: dvādaśādityamabhyarya vahniṃ revantamindrakam /
column2: One who worships the twelve Ādityas suns, Firegod, Revanta and Indra, gets free from diseases etc.

column1: rogādimuktaḥ svargī syācchrīkapardivināyakam // prapūjya kārttikeyañca nirvighnaḥ siddhimāpnuyāt /
column2: and attains heaven. One who worships Kapardi, Vināyaka and lord Kārttikeya Subrahmaṇya nourished the six Kṛttikās gets his desire accomplished without any impediment.

column1: siddheśvarañca rudreśaṃ rāmeśaṃ brahmakeśvaram / aṣṭaliṅgāni guhyāni pūjayitvā tu sarvabhāk //
column2: One would get everything by worshipping the eight mysterious liṅgasSomanātha, Kāleśa, Kedāra, Prapitāmaha, Siddheśvara, Rudreśa, Rāmeśa and Brahmakeśvara.

column1: nārāyaṇaṃ varāhañca nārasiṃhaṃ namecchriye /
column2: By worshipping lords Nārāyaṇa, Varāha and Nārasiṃha one would get prosperity.

column1: brahmaviṣṇumaheśākhyaṃ tripuraghnamaśeṣadam //
column2: By worshipping lords Brahmā, Viṣṇu, Maheśa and Tripuraghna destroyer of Tripura one would get all things.

column1: sītāṃ rāmañca garuḍaṃ vāmanaṃ samprapūjya ca / sarvakāmānavāpnoti brahmalokaṃ nayet pitṝn //
column2: He who worships Sītā, Rāma, Garuḍa and Vāmana gets all the desired things and conveys his forefathers to the region of Brahmā.

column1: devaiḥ sārdhaṃ samprapūjya devamādigadādharam / ṛṇatrayavinirmuktastārayet sakalaṃ kulam //
column2: By worshipping lord Ādigadādhara in the company of celestials, one gets free from three debts and redeems the entire family.

column1: devarūpā śilā puṇyā tasmāddevamayī śilā /
column2: The stone slab is of the form of celestials and it is hence meritorious.

column1: gayāyāṃ nahi tat sthānaṃ yatra tīrthaṃ na vidyate //
column2: There is no place in Gayā where there is no sacred spot.

column1: yannāmnā pātayet piṇḍaṃ tannayedbrahma śāśvatam /
column2: That person in whose name a piṇḍa is offered, is conveyed to the region of Brahmā eternally.

column1: phalgvīśaṃ phalgucaṇḍīṃ ca praṇamyāṅgārakeśvaram // mataṅgasya pade śrāddhī bharatāśramake bhavet /
column2: After having paid obeisance to Phalgvīśa, Phalgucaṇḍī and Aṅgārakeśvara, one should perform the ancestral rite at the place of Mataṅga and Bharatāśrama.

column1: haṃsatīrthe koṭitīrthe yatra pāṇḍuśilānnadaḥ //
column2: So also one should offer food at Haṃsatīrtha, Koṭitīrtha and Pāṇḍuśilā.

column1: tatra syādagnidhārāyāṃ madhusravasi piṇḍadaḥ /
column2: There, at the Agnidhārā, and at Madhusravas, piṇḍa should be offered.

column1: piṇḍado dhenukāraṇye pade dhenor namecca gām /
column2: One should offer piṇḍa at the forest of Dhenukā and worship the cow at Dhenupada.

column1: sarvān pitṝṃstārayecca sarasvatyāñca piṇḍadaḥ //
column2: One who offers piṇḍa in the Sarasvatī river redeems all the forefathers.

column1: sandhyāmupāsya sāyāhne nameddevīṃ sarasvatīm /
column2: After having worshipped the evening twilight, one should pay obeisance to goddess Sarasvatī.

column1: trisandhyākṛdbhavedvipro vedavedāṅgapāragaḥ //
column2: The brahmins proficient in the Vedas and Vedāṅgas should do the three twilight worships.

column1: gayāṃ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya gayāviprān prapūjya ca / annadānādikaṃ sarvaṃ kṛtantatrākṣayaṃ bhavet //
column2: After having done circumambulation of Gayā and having worshipped the brahmins at Gayā, offer of food or anything else becomes undecaying.

column1: stutvā samprārthayedevamādidevaṃ gadādharam / gadādharaṃ gayāvāsaṃ pitrādīnāṃ gatipradam // dharmārthakāmamokṣārthaṃ yogadaṃ praṇamāmyaham /
column2: The lord Ādigadādhara should be glorified and prayed to as follows “ pray to the conferer of yoga, lord Gadādhara, the resident of Gayā, who redeems the forefathers for the sake of dharma righteousness, artha prosperity kāma pleasure and mokṣa redemption.

column1: dehendriyamanobuddhiprāṇāhaṅkāravarjitam // nityaśuddhaṃ buddhiyuktaṃ satyaṃ brahma namāmyaham /
column2: salute that true brahman, who is devoid of a body, organs, mind, intellect, lifeforce and ego who is always pure, and who is endowed with intellect.

column1: ānandamadvayaṃ devaṃ devadānavavanditam // devadevīvṛndayuktaṃ sarvadā praṇamāmyaham /
column2: always salute the lord who is bliss, without a second form, who is worshipped by the celestials and demons, and who is surrounded by gods and goddesses.

column1: kalikalmaṣakālārtidamanaṃ vanamālinam // pālitākhilalokeśaṃ kuloddharaṇamānasam / vyaktāvyaktavibhaktātmāvibhaktātmānamātmani //
column2: pay obeisance to the destroyer of the sinful propensities of the Kali period, the person wearing the garland of wild flowers, the protector of all the worlds, the one bent on the redemption of the family, the one divided himself into the manifest and unmanifest.

column1: sthitaṃ sthirataraṃ sāraṃ vande ghorāghamardanam /
column2: worship that destroyer of frightful sins and one who remains as the permanent essence.

column1: āgato 'smi gayāṃ deva pitṛkārye gadādharaḥ //
column2: O lord! Gadādhara! have come to Gayā in order to do the ancestral rite.

column1: tvaṃ me sākṣī bhavādyeha anṛṇo 'hamṛṇatrayāt /
column2: You be the witness for me here today. Let me be free from three kinds of debts.

column1: sākṣiṇaḥ santu me devā brahmeśānādayas tathā //
column2: May the gods Brahmā, Īśāna and others be the witness for me.

column1: mayā gayāṃ samāsādya pitṝṇāṃ niṣkṛtiḥ kṛtā /
column2: have come to Gayā and have redeemed my forefathers.

column1: gayāmāhātmyapaṭhanācchrāddhādau brahmalokabhāk // pitṝṇāmakṣayaṃ śrāddhamakṣayaṃ brahmalokadam //43//
column2: Whoever reads about the greatness of Gayā at the time of doing the ancestral rite, attains the region of Brahmā. The ancestral rite done to the forefathers becomes undecaying and it confers the region of Brahmā.

column1: kātyāyanī munīnāha yathā śrāddhaṃ tathā vade / gayādau śrāddhaṃ kurvīta saṅkrāntyādau viśeṣataḥ //
column2: shall describe the mode of performing śrāddha ancestral rite as described by sage Kātyāyana to the sages. One should do śrāddha at Gayā especially on the saṅkrānti etc.

column1: kāle vāparapakṣe ca caturthyā ūrdhvameva va /
column2: or on the day of the new moon or on days after the fourth day.

column1: samyādya ca padarkṣe ca pūrvedyuś ca nimantrayet // yatīn gṛhasthasādhūn vā snātakāñchrotriyān dvijān / anavadyān karmaniṣṭhān śiṣṭānācārasaṃyutān //
column2: After having reached there, one should invite any one of the following for the śrāddha the mendicants, pious householders one who has completed his studies, learned brahmins, those who are faultless, those who strictly observe the propriety of conduct.

column1: varjayecchitrikuṣṭhyādīnna gṛhṇīyānnimantritān /
column2: Persons afflicted by white leprosy or leprosy should not be invited.

column1: snātāñchucīṃs tathā dāntān prāṅmukhān devakarmaṇi //
column2: They should have bathed, be pure and have selfcontrol. They should face the east while doing divine acts.

column1: upaveśayettrīn pitryādīnekaikamubhayatra vā / evaṃ mātāmahādeś ca śākair api ca kārayet //
column2: The three forefathers father, grandfather and great grandfather should separately be invoked. So also the forefathers on the maternal side to whom one is entitled to offer should be invoked.

column1: tadahni brahmacārī syādakopo 'tvarito mṛduḥ / satyo 'pramatto 'nadhvanyo asvādhyāyaś ca vāgyataḥ //
column2: The performer of the śrāddha should observe continence that day. He should be gentle, calm, not hasty, true and not intoxicated. He should not stir out.

column1: sarvāṃś ca paṅktimūrdhanyān pṛcchet praśne tathāsane / darbhānāstīrya dviguṇān pitre devādikañcaret //
column2: Kind enquiries should be made of the chief among those seated. Even number of darbha should be spread for the forefathers. The appropriate deity should be invoked.

column1: viśvāndevānāvāhayiṣye pṛcchedāvāhayeti ca / viśvedevāsa āvāhya vikīryātha yavān japet //
column2: One should ask, “Shall invoke Viśvedevas?” He should be replied, “you invoke”. After having invoked Viśvedevas, and having spread barley, one should repeat the following

column1: viśve devāḥ śṛṇutemaṃ pitṝnāvāhayiṣye ca /
column2: O Viśvedevas! You hear this.

column1: pṛcchedāvāhayetyukte uśantastvā samāhvayet // tilān vikīryātha japedāyāntvityādi pitrake /
column2: invoke the forefathers. Having asked thus and being permitted to invoke, one should invoke them saying “You be pleased.”

column1: sapitritre niṣiñcedvā śanno devīrabhi tṛcā // yavo 'sīti yavān datvā pitre sarvatra vai tilān /
column2: After having spread the sesamum, one should invoke the forefathers with the repetition of the mantra, “Forefathers” One should sprinkle on the kuśa with the mantra śaṃ no devī.

column1: tilo 'si somadevatyo gosavo devanirmitaḥ /
column2: You are permeated with the essence of Soma.

column1: śrīś ca teti dadetpuṣpaṃ pātre haime 'tha rājate // audumvare vā khaḍge vā parṇapātre pradakṣiṇam /
column2: Graciously gratify the souls of forefathers. Salutations.” Flowers should be offered with the mantra “śrīśca te” in a golden or silver vessel or a wooden vessel or sword or vessel made of a leaf.

column1: devānāmapasavyaṃ tu pitṝṇāṃ savyamācaret // ekaikasya ekaikena sapavitrakareṣu ca /
column2: The circumambulation is done clockwise in the case of celestials and anticlockwise in the case of forefathers, wearing the pavitra made of darbha on the hand, one for each one of the forefathers.

column1: viśve devā eṣa vo 'rghaḥ svāhā ca pitareṣa te //
column2: Similarly, offerings should be made to the forefathers saying “Here is the offering for you, O Forefathers!

column1: avadhaivaṃ pitāmahadeḥ saṃsravāt prathame caret / pitṛbhyaḥ sthānamasīti nyubjaṃ pātraṃ karotyadhaḥ //
column2: Similarly, offerings should be made to the grandfathers with the mantra “Obeisance to the grandfathers.” The sacrificial vessel is lowered with the repetition of the mantra “You are the seats of my forefathers.”

column1: atra gandhapuṣpadhūpadīpācchādanadānakaṃ / ghṛtāktamannamuddhṛtya pṛcchatyagnau kariṣye ca //
column2: Then perfumes, flowers, incense sticks, lamps, shawls and food with clarified butter should be raised up by the performer of ancestral rite.

column1: kuruṣvetyabhyanujñāto juhuyātsāgniko 'nale / anagnikaḥ pitṛhaste sapavitre tu mantrataḥ //
column2: Being permitted by the brahmins to do so, those things should be offered to the fire in the case of those who maintain fire and on the hands of forefathers in the case of those who do not maintain fire with the repetition of the following mantra and wearing the pavitra made of darbha worn on the finger.

column1: agnaye kavyavāhanāya svāheti prathamāhutiḥ / somāya pitṛmate 'tha yamāyāṅgirase pare //
column2: The first oblation is made with the mantra “Obeisance to the Firegod, the conveyor of offerings.” The subsequent mantras are to Soma, to forefathers, to the god of death and Aṅgiras.

column1: hutaśeṣaṃ cānnapātre datvā pātraṃ samālabhet /
column2: The remnants of oblations should be collected in the food vessel.

column1: japtvedaṃ viṣṇurityanne dvijāṅguṣṭhanniveśayet //
column2: am casting in that mouth permeated with the nectar.” After having repeated the mantra “This Viṣṇu”, the thumb of the brahmin is placed in the food.

column1: apahateti ca tilān vikīryānnaṃ pradāyayet /
column2: The sesamum should be scattered with the mantra “Removed”, and the food should be given.

column1: juṣadhvamiti coktvātha gāyatryādi tato japet //
column2: After saying, “Be pleased”, the gāyatrī and other mantras should be repeated.

column1: devatābhyaḥ pitṛbhyaś ca mahāyogibhya eva ca / namaḥ svadhāyai svāhayai nityameva namo namaḥ //
column2: “Obeisance to the gods, the forefathers, great yogins, Svadhā and Svāhā always.”

column1: tṛptān jñātvānnaṃ vikiredapo dadyāt sakṛt sakṛt /
column2: After having known that they are satisfied, the food must be scattered and water should be given to each one of them.

column1: gāyatrīṃ pūrvavajjaptvā madhu madhviti vai japet //
column2: After repeating the gāyatrī mantra as before, the mantra “honey, honey” should be repeated.

column1: sadāśivaḥ piṅgalaś ca bhṛgvānandaś ca nāthakaḥ /
column2: One should worship within the circle Sadāśiva, Piṅgala, Bhṛgvānanda, Nāthaka, Rāṅgūlānanda and Saṃvarta.

column1: lāṅgūlānandasaṃvartau maṇḍalasthānake yajet // nairṛtye śrīmahakālaḥ pinākī ca mahendrakaḥ / khaḍgo bhujaṅgo vāṇaś ca aghāsiḥ śabdako vaśaḥ // ājñārūpo nandarūpo balindatvā kramaṃ yajet /
column2: Śrīmahākāla, Pinākī, Mahendraka, Khaḍga, Bhujaṅga, Bāṇa, Aghāsi, Śabdaka, Vaśa, Ājñārūpa and Nandarūpa should be worshipped in the southwest after making the offering victim with the following mantraHroṃ khaṃ khaṃ hūṃ sauṃ obeisance to god Vaṭuka. Aru aru you accept, accept argha water offered as token of respect, flower, incense, lamp, perfumes and bali offering.

column1: baliśeṣe 'tha yajet hrīṃ hrūṃ hāṃ śrīṃ vai trikūṭakaṃ // vāme ca dakṣiṇe hy agre yāmye niśānāthapādukāḥ /
column2: Oṃ hrāṃ hrīṃ hrūṃ kṣeṃ obeisance to the guardian of the ground. You descend, descend. One bearing the great grown matted hair! One having a face shining with the flames in the three eyes! You come.

column1: dakṣe tamorināthasya hagre kālānalasya ca //
column2: Accept, accept worship with perfumes, flowers and bali offering.

column1: uḍḍiyāṇaṃ jālandharaṃ pūrṇaṃ vai kāmarupakaṃ / gaganānandadevañca svargānandaṃ savargakaṃ // paramānandadevañca satyānandasya pādukāṃ / nāgānandañca vargākhyamuktānte ratnapañcakaṃ //
column2: The sandals of Niśānātha are worshipped in the south, Tandrinātha on the right and Kālānala in the front. The mountains Uḍḍiyāṇa, Jālandhara, Pūrṇa and Kāmarūpa and the five gems Gaganānandadeva, Svargānanda, Paramānandadeva, the sandals of Satyānanda and Nāgānanda should be worshipped in the north.

column1: saumye śive yajet ṣaṭkaṃ suranāthasya pādukāṃ / śrīmatsamayakoṭīśaṃ vidyākoṭīśvaraṃ yajet //
column2: One should worship the sixthe sandal of Suranātha Indra, Śrīsamayakoṭīśa, Vidyākoṭīśvara, Koṭīśa, Bindukoṭīśa and Siddhakoṭīśvara in the northeast.

column1: siddhacatuṣkamāgneyyāṃ amarīśeśvaraṃ yajet // cakrīśanāthaṃ kuruṅgeśaṃ vṛtreśañcandranāthakaṃ /
column2: The siddhacatuṣka four siddhasAmarīśeśvara, Cakrīśanātha, Kuraṅgeśa, Vṛtreśa and Candranāthaka should be worshipped in the southeast with perfumes etc.

column1: yajedanādivimalaṃ sarvajñavimalaṃ tataḥ / yajedyogīśavimalaṃ siddhākhyaṃ samayākhyakaṃ //
column2: The Vimalapañcaka five VimalasAnādivimala, Sarvajñavimala, Yogīśavimala, Siddha Siddhavimala and Samaya Samayavimala should be worshipped in the south.

column1: naiṛtye caturo devān jayet kandarpanāthakaṃ / pūrvāḥ śaktīś ca sarvāś ca kubjikāpādukāṃ yajet //
column2: One should worship the four gods Kandarpanātha and others, all the female energies already described and the sandals of goddess Kubjikā.

column1: navātamkena mantreṇa pañcapraṇavakena vā / sahasrākṣamanavadyaṃ viṣṇuṃ śivaṃ sadā yajet //
column2: The votary should always worship the thousandeyed and blemishless god Viṣṇu and god Śiva with the mantra of nine syllables or five praṇava mantras.

column1: pūrvācchivāntaṃ brahmādi brahmāṇī ca maheśvarī /
column2: Brahmā and other gods should be worshipped from the east to the northeast.

column1: kaumārī vaiṣṇavī caiva vārāhī śakraśaktikā // cāmuṇḍā ca mahālakṣmīḥ pūrvādīśāntamarcayet /
column2: The goddesses Brahmāṇī, Māheśvarī, Kaumārī, Vaiṣṇavī, Vārāhī, Indrāṇī, Cāmuṇḍā and Mahālakṣmī should be worshipped from the east to the northeast.

column1: ḍākinī rākinī pūjyā lākinī kākinī tathā // śākinī yākinī pūjyā vāyavyādugraṣaṭṣu ca /
column2: The goddesses Ḍākinī, Rākiṇī, Kākinī, Śākinī and Yākinī should be worshipped in the six directions commencing from the northwest.

column1: pañcapraṇavakenāpi hrīṃ kāreṇāthavā yajet /
column2: The goddess composed of thirtytwo letters should be worshipped with five praṇavas or syllable hrīṃ.

column1: nīlotpaladalaśyāmā ṣaḍvaktrā ṣaṭprakārikā // cicchaktiktiraṣṭādaśākhyā bāhudvādaśasaṃyutā / siṃhāsanasukhāsīnā pretapadmoparisthitā // kulakoṭisahasrāḍhyā karkoṭo mekhalāsthitaḥ /
column2: She should be contemplated upon as of dark complexion like the petals of blue lotus, having six faces, of six kinds, as eighteen kinds of cicchakti faculties of the mind, possessing twelve arms, seated comfortably on the throne, remaining on the lotus of absolute dead of primordial matter, and shining with the splendour of multitudes of kulas.

column1: takṣakeṇopariṣṭācca gale hāraś ca vāsukiḥ // kulikaḥ karṇayoryasyāḥ kūrmaḥ kuṇḍalamaṇḍalahḥ / bhruvoḥ padmo makāpadmo vāme nāgaḥ kapālakaḥ // akṣasūtrañca khaṭvāṅgaṃ śaṅkaṃ pustañca dakṣiṇe / triśūlantadarpaṇaṃ khaḍgaṃ ratnamālāṅkuśandhanuḥ //
column2: She should also be contemplated as having Karkoṭaka one of the eight principal cobras as the girdle, Takṣaka a cobra above, Vāsuki a cobra as a garland on the neck, Kulika a cobra on the ears, the tortoise as the earstud, the serpents Padma and Mahāpadma forming the eyebrows, and having skull, a serpent, rosary, a club with a skull at the top, a conch and a look in her left hand and a trident, a mirror, a sword, a garland of gems, dart and a bow in the right hand.

column1: śvetamūrdhvamukhandevyā ūrdhvaśvetantathāparaṃ / pūrvāsyaṃ pāṇḍaraṃ krodhi dakṣiṇaṃ kṛṣṇavarṇakaṃ //
column2: The upper front face of the goddess should be contemplated as having a white complexion and elevated, the eastern face pale, the southern one angry, the western face of black colour, and the northern one of the colour of snow and jasmine.

column1: viṣṇustu jaghane rudro hṛdi kaṇṭhe tatheśvaraḥ // sadāśivo lalāṭe syācchivastasyordhvataḥ sthitaḥ /
column2: Moreover, Brahmā should be imagined to be as remaining at the foot, Viṣṇu at the buttocks, Rudra at the heart, Īśvara at the neck, Sadāśiva at the forehead, Śiva as remaining above her.

column1: āghūrṇitā kubjikaivandhyeyā pūjādikarmasu //
column2: Kubjikā should thus be contemplated as whirling in all acts of worship. .

column1: nānāmantrān pravakṣyāmi ṣoḍhānyāsapuraḥsaram /
column2: shall describe different kinds of mantras preceded by ṣoḍhānyāsa the six ways of touching the body with the mantras.

column1: nyāsastridhā tu ṣoḍhā syuḥ śāktaśāmbhavayāmalāḥ // śāmbhave śabdarāśiḥ ṣaṭṣoḍaśagranthirūpavān /
column2: There are three kinds of ṣoḍhānyāsathe śākta, Śāmbhava and yāmala devoted to the goddess, lord Śiva and both. In the śāmbhava rite, the six terms would have sixteen knots.

column1: trividyā tadgraho nyāsastritattvātmābhidhānakaḥ //
column2: The three kinds of knowables are related to the nyāsa of this kind. It connotes the principles.

column1: caturtho vanamālāyāḥ ślokadvādaśarūpavān /
column2: The fourth nyāsa is of the vanamālā of twelve ślokas letters.

column1: pañcamo ratnapañcātmā navātmā ṣaṣṭha īritaḥ //
column2: The fifth nyāsa is known as the Ratnapañcātmā comprising the five gems and the sixth one is said to be the Navātmā comprising nine.

column1: śākte pakṣe ca mālinyāstrividyātmā dvitīyakaḥ /
column2: In the case of śākta nyāsa, the first one is Mālinī nyāsa the second one is trividyā, the next one third is the nyāsa of the eight aghoris.

column1: adhoryaṣṭakarūpo 'nyo dvādaśāṅgaś caturthakaḥ /
column2: The fourth one is on the twelve parts of the body.

column1: pañcamastu ṣaḍaṅgaḥ syācchaktiścānyāstracaṇḍikā /
column2: The fifth one is of six parts. The sixth one is of the astracaṇḍikā of the form of śakti goddess.

column1: krīṃ hrauṃ klīṃ śrīṃ krūṃ phaṭ trayaṃ syātturyākhyaṃ sarvasādhakaṃ //
column2: Krīṃ hrauṃ klīṃ śrīṃ krūṃ phaṭ are the mantras in the above three, known as the fourth accomplishing everything.

column1: mālinyā nādikāntaṃ syāt nādinī ca śikhā smṛtā /
column2: The mālinī would be from na to pha. The nādinī is known to be the tuft.

column1: agrasenī śirasi syāt śiromālānivṛttiḥ śaḥ //
column2: The agrasani would be on the head. The letter śa should be like a garland around the head.

column1: ṭa śāntiś ca śiro bhūyāc cāmuṇḍā ca trinetragā /
column2: The letter ṭa representing peace be on the head. Goddess Cāmuṇḍā be on the three eyes.

column1: ḍha priyadṛṣṭirdvinetre ca nāsāgā guhyaśaktinī // na nārāyaṇī dvikarṇe ca dakṣakarṇe ta mohanau /
column2: The letter ḍha denoting pleasing look should be on the two eyes. The goddess Guhyaśaktinī should be on the nostrils. The letter na standing for goddess Nārāyaṇī should be on the two ears.

column1: ja prajñā vāmakarnasthā vaktre ca vajriṇī smṛtā //
column2: The letter ja representing wisdom should remain on the left ear. Goddess Vajriṇī is known to be on the face.

column1: ka karālī dakṣadaṃṣṭrā vāmāṃsā kha kapālinī /
column2: The letter ka representing the goddess Karālī of horrible features should be on the right tooth.

column1: ga śivā ūrdhvadaṃṣṭrā syād gha ghorā vāmadaṃṣṭrikā //
column2: The letter ga representing the goddess Śivā be on the upper tooth. The letter gha representing the goddess Ghorā should be on the left tooth.

column1: u śikhā dantavinyāsā ī māyā jihvayā smṛtā / a syānnāgeśvarī vāci va kaṇṭhe śikhivāhinī //
column2: The letter u denoting the goddess Śikhā has her place on the tooth. The letter ī representing the goddess Māyā is represented by the tongue.

column1: bha bhīṣaṇī dakṣaskandhe vāyuvegā ma vāmake / ḍanāmā dakṣabāhau tu ḍha vāme ca vināyakā //
column2: The letter bha representing the goddess Bhīṣaṇī frightening is located on the right shoulder. The letter ma representing the goddess Vāyuvegā swift as the wind should be located on the left shoulder.

column1: pa pūrṇimā dvihaste tu okārādyaṅgulīyake /
column2: The letter pa denoting Pūrṇimā the full moon be located on the two hands.

column1: aṃ darśanī vāmāṅgulya aḥ syātsañjīvanī kare //
column2: The letter aḥ be located on the hand representing Sañjīvanī the vitalising force.

column1: ṭa kapālinī kapālaṃ śūladaṇḍe ta dīpanī /
column2: The letter ṭa be located on the skull representing Kapālinī the goddess wearing garland of skulls.

column1: triśūle ja jayantī syādvṛddhiryaḥ sādhanī smṛtā //
column2: The letter ca representing Jayantī the goddess who is victorious be located on the trident.

column1: jīve śa paramākhyā syād ha prāṇe cāmbikā smṛtā /
column2: The letter ha remembered to be representing Ambikā the mother goddess be located in the vital principle of life.

column1: dakṣastane cha śarīrā na vāme pūtanā stane // a stanakṣīrā ā moṭo lambodaryudare ca tha /
column2: The letter cha representing Śarīrā the goddess with a visible body be located on the right breast. The letter na representing Pūtanā the demoness be located on the left breast.

column1: nābhau saṃhārikā kṣa syān mahākālī nitambama //
column2: Mahākālī the most ferocious goddess be located at the buttocks.

column1: guhye sa kusumamālā ṣa śukre śukradevikā /
column2: The letter ṣa representing Śukradevikā the goddess of fertility be located in the semen.

column1: urudvaye ta tārāsyāha jñānā dakṣajānuni //
column2: The letter da signifying Jñānā the goddess of knowledge be located on the right knee.

column1: vāme syādau kriyāśaktiro gāyatrī ca jaṅghagā /
column2: The letter au representing u Kriyāśakti the energy of activity may be located in the left knee.

column1: o sāvitrī vāmajaṅghā dakṣe do dohanī pade //
column2: The letter o representing goddess Sāvitrī be located on the left groin.

column1: u dakṣakarṇe 'marauśa ū karṇerghāṃśako 'pare //
column2: The letter do representing goddess Dohinī be located on the right groin.

column1: pañcāntakaḥ kūrpare go gha śikhī dakṣakaṅgaṇe /
column2: The letter pha representing the goddess Phetkāri should be located at the left foot.

column1: ṅa ekapādaścāṅgulyo tāmaskandhe ca kūrmakaḥ // cha ekanetro bāhau syāccaturvaktro ja kūrpare /
column2: The letter a denoting the god Śrīkaṇṭha be located on the tuft. The letter ā representing the god Ananta be located on the face.

column1: pa lohito dakṣakukṣau pha śikhī vāmakukṣigaḥ //
column2: The letter i standing for the god Sūkṣma be located on the right eye.

column1: ba galaṇḍaḥ pṛṣṭhavaṃśe bho nābhau ca dviraṇḍakaḥ /
column2: The letter ī signifying the lord Trimūrti of three forms be located at the left eye.

column1: va khaḍgīśaḥ svātmani syādvakaścāthini śaḥ smṛtaḥ // ṣa śvetaś caiva majjāyāṃ sa bhṛguḥ śukradhātuke / prāṇe ho nakulīśaḥ syāt kṣa saṃvartaś ca koṣagaḥ //
column2: The letter u representing Amarīśa the lord of celestials be located at the right ear. The letter ū representing Ardhāṃśaka one who has assumed half of the divine form be located at the other ear left ear. The letter ṛ denoting Bhāvabhūti the lord of ensuing fortune be located at the tip of the nose.

column1: rudraśaktīḥ prapūjya hrīṃvījenākhilamāpnuyāt //31//
column2: One would get all things by the worship of the energy of Rudra with the syllable hrīṃ.

column1: trikhaṇḍīṃ sampravakṣāmi brahmaviṣṇumaheśvarīṃ /
column2: shall describe the three parts of mantras relating to the gods Brahmā, Viṣṇu and Maheśvara.

column1: brahmakhaṇḍapade rudrair ekaviṃśādhikaṃ śataṃ //
column2: Oṃ obeisance to the lord Rudra. Obeisance. Obeisance to Cāmuṇḍā.

column1: yathākṣarapadānāṃ hi viṣṇukhaṇḍandvitīyakaṃ /
column2: O Cāmuṇḍā! Vaiṣṇavī relating to Viṣṇu! Aghorā! Amoghā! Varadā! Viccā! Oblations.

column1: ekatriṃśatpadaṃ śambhoḥ śatamantraikasaptatiḥ //
column2: There are thirtyone terms for Śambhu Śiva and the syllables are one hundred and seventyone.

column1: he ghauṃ pañcapraṇavādyantāṃ trikhaṇḍīñca japed yajet /
column2: One should repeat trikhaṇḍī mantra mantra of three parts with the syllables he and ghauṃ preceded and followed by the five praṇavas oṃkāras and worship.

column1: he ghauṃ śrīkubjikāhṛdayaṃ padasandhau tu yojayet //
column2: The sacred secret mantra he ghauṃ of the goddess Kubjikā should be added in between the terms.

column1: akuntāditrimadhyasthaṃ kulādeś ca trimadhyagaṃ / madhyamādi trimadhyasthaṃ piṇḍaṃ pāde trimadhyagaṃ //
column2: It should be in the middle of the three akulādi, the three kulādi, the three madhyama and the piṇḍa at the foot. It must have one and a half vowels and praṇava etc.

column1: trayārdhamātrāsaṃyuktaṃ praṇavādyaṃ śikhāśivāṃ / hrāṃ hrīṃ hraiṃ nirvījantryarṇaṃ dvātriṃśadvarṇakamparaṃ //
column2: at the tuft of Śivā. Oṃ kṣrauṃ obeisance to Śikhābhairava. Skhīṃ Skhīṃ Skheṃ the three letters with the bīja basic mantra. Hrāṃ hrīṃ hraiṃ without the bīja, the three waters and the supreme thritytwo letters.

column1: kṣādayaś ca kakārāntā akulā ca kulakramāt /
column2: The letters kṣa, ka are the akula mantras according to the order of Kula.

column1: śaśinī bhānunī caiva pāvanī śiva ity ataḥ // gāndharī ṇaś ca piṇḍākṣī capalā gajajihvikā /
column2: The goddesses of energy are Śaśinī goddess in the moon, Bhānavī the energy in the sun, Pāvanī the purifier, Śivā, Gāndhārī whose essence is the letter ṇa, Piṇḍākṣī of round eyes, Capalā fickleminded, Gajajihvikā tongue like that of an elephant.

column1: ma mṛṣā bhayasārā syānmadhyamā pho 'jarāya ca //
column2: The letter ma represents the goddesses Mṛṣā untruth and Bhayasāra the essence of fear.

column1: kumāro kālarātrī na saṅkaṭā da dha kālikā / pha śivā bhavaghorā ṇa ṭa vībhatsā ta vidyutā //
column2: The letter na represents goddesses Kumārī maiden, Kālarātrī dreadful night at the time of deluge. The letters da and dha respectively represent goddesses Saṅkaṭā difficulty and Kālikā of dark complexion.

column1: ṭha viśvambharā śaṃśinyā ḍha jvālāmālayā tathā / karālī durjayā raṅgī vāmā jyeṣṭhā ca raudryapi //
column2: The letter ḍha is the representation of Śaṃsinī the goddess of doubt, Jvālāmālā garland of flames, Karālī ugliness, Durjayā invincible, Raṅgī sportive, Vāmā beautiful, Jyeṣṭhā the eldest and Raudrī terrible.

column1: kha kālī ka kulālamvī anulomā da piṇḍinī / ā vedinī i rūpī vai śāntirmūrtiḥ kalākulā // ṛ khaḍginī u balitā ḷ kulā ḹ tathā yadi / subhagā vedanādinyā karālī aṃ ca madhyamā //
column2: The letter kha represents Kālī the goddess of time, kaKulālambī goddess regulating succession of events, daAnulomā of descending order and Piṇḍinī regulating the three primordial forces, āVedinī of the form of pain, i Śāntimūrti of the form of peace and Kalākulā embodying the arts, ṛKhaḍginī the swordwielding goddess, uBalitā strong, l Kulā belonging to the kula class, l Subhagā fortunate, Vedanā pains, ṛKarālī dreadful, aṃMadhyamā middle one and aḥApetarayā unimpetuous.

column1: aḥ apetarayā pīṭhe pūjyāś ca kaktayaḥ kramāt /
column2: These goddesses of energy should be duly worshipped on the altar.

column1: skhāṃ skhīṃ skhauṃ mahābhairavāya namaḥ /
column2: Skhāṃ skhīṃ skhauṃ obeisance to the great Bhairava.

column1: akṣodyā hy ṛkṣakarṇī ca rākṣasī kṣapaṇakṣayā // piṅgākṣī cākṣayā kṣemā brahmāṇyaṣṭakasaṃsthitāḥ /
column2: The goddesses Akṣodyā uncrushable, Akṣakarṇī eyes reaching up to the ear, Rākṣasī demoness, Kṣapaṇakṣayā indestructible, Piṅgākṣī having tawny coloured eyes, Akṣayā undecaying, Kṣemā of the form of welfare, and Brahmāṇī energy relating to Brahmā are the eight belonging to the group of Brahmāṇī.

column1: ilā līlāvatī nīlā laṅgā laṅkeśvarī tathā // lālasā vimalā mālā māheśvarya.aṣṭake sthitāḥ /
column2: The goddesses Ilā representing the earth, ṛilāvatī sportive, Nīlā bluecoloured, Laṅkā, Laṅkeśvarī, Lālasā extreme desire, Vimalā spotless constitute the group of Māheśvarī relating to Śiva.

column1: hutāśanā viśālākṣī hrūṅkārī vaḍavāmukhī // hāhāravā tathā krūrā krodhā bālā kharānanā /
column2: The goddesses Hutāśanā fire, Viśālākṣī largeeyed, Hrūṅkārī of the form of syllable hrūṃ Vaḍavāmukhī having volkanic fires in the mouth Hāhāravā having wailing sound, Krūrā cruel, Krodhā angry, Bālā graceful and Kharānanā having the face of an ass had their origin from the body of the goddess Kaumārī virginity.

column1: kaumāryā dehasambhūtāḥ pūjitāḥ sarvasiddhidāḥ //
column2: They are accomplishers of all things when worshipped.

column1: ssarvajñā taralā tārā ṛgvedā ca hayānanā / sārāsārasvayaṅgrāhā śāśvatī vaiṣṇavīkule //
column2: The goddesses Sarvajñā omniscient, Taralā tremulous, Tārā shining, Ṛgvedā the goddess of the Ṛgveda, Hayānanā horsefaced, Sārā essence, Sārasvayaṃgrāhā one who herself absorbs the essence and Śāśvatī eternal one had their origin in the family of goddess Vaiṣṇavī relating to Viṣṇu.

column1: tālujihvā ca raktākṣī vidyujjihvā karaṅkiṇī / meghanādā pracaṇḍogrā kālakarṇī kalipriyā //
column2: The goddesses Tālujihvā of the form ofa crocodile, Raktākṣī redeyed, Vidyujjihvā lightning like tongue, Karaṅkiṇī having the skull, Meghanādā sounding like the cloud, Pracaṇḍogrā terribly ferocious, Kālakarṇī representing misfortune and Kalipriyā fond of strife were born of the family of the goddess Vārāhī relating to the boar form.

column1: vārāhīkulasambhūtāḥ pūjanīyā jayārthinā /
column2: They should be worshipped by those who seek victory.
