column1: musalena hato rājñā svarṇasteyī viśuddhyati //
column2: One who has stolen gold gets purified if the king beats him to death with a club.

column1: adhaḥśāyī jaṭādhārī parṇamūlaphalāśanaḥ /
column2: Otherwise he should lie down on the floor, bear matted hair, eat leaf, root and fruit and eat well only once a day.

column1: ekakālaṃ samaśnāno dvādaśābde viśuddhyati //
column2: He gets purified after twelve years.

column1: rukmasteyī surāpaś ca brahmahā gurutalpagaḥ / steyaṃ kṛtvā surāṃ pītvā kṛcchrañcābdaṃ carennaraḥ //
column2: A person who had stolen gold or drunk wine or killed a brahmin or cohabited the wife of the preceptor or committed theft or drunk wine should practise kṛcchra for a year.

column1: maṇimuktāpravālānāṃ tāmrasya rajatasya ca / ayaskāṃsyopalānāñca dvādaśāhaṃ kaṇānnabhuk //
column2: One who steals gems, pearls and corals, copper, silver, iron, bronze and stones should eat little quantity of food for twelve days.

column1: manuṣyāṇāntu haraṇe strīṇāṃ kṣetragṛhasya ca /
column2: The expiation for abduction of men or women or taking possession of lands or houses or wells or tanks is said to be cāndrāyaṇa.

column1: puṣpamūlaphalānāñca pañcagavyaṃ viśodhanaṃ //
column2: The five things got from a cow are the purification for the stealing of eatables, food, vehicle, bed, seat, flowers, roots and fruits.

column1: tṛṇakāṣṭhadrumāṇāñca śuṣkānnasya guḍasya ca / celacarmāmiṣāṇāñca trirātraṃ syādabhojanaṃ //
column2: One should not take food for three nights for having stolen the grass, wood, tree, dry food, jaggery, dress, hide and flesh.

column1: pituḥ patnīñca bhaginīmācāryatanayāntathā / ācāryāṇīṃ sutāṃ svāñca gacchaṃś ca gurutalpagaḥ //
column2: One who cohabits his mother, sister, the daughter of his preceptor, the wife of the preceptor and his own daughter should be deemed to have violated his teacher’s bed.

column1: gurutalpe 'bhibhāṣyainastapte pacyādayomaye / śūmīṃ jvalantīñcāśliṣya mṛtunā sa viśuddhyati //
column2: He should be declared as having violated his teacher’s bed and made to embrace a heated and glowing iron image of a woman and he becomes purified by death.

column1: cāndrāyaṇān vā trīnmāsānabhyasya gurutalpagaḥ /
column2: Otherwise a person who has violated the bed of his teacher should practise cāndrāyaṇa for three months.

column1: evameva vidhiṃ kuryād yoṣitsu patitāsvapi //
column2: One should follow the same procedure for having cohabited even fallen women.

column1: yat puṃsaḥ paradāreṣu taccaināṃ kārayedvrataṃ /
column2: One should perform that vow for such women which a person would perform for others’ wives.

column1: retaḥ siktvā kumārīṣu cāṇḍālīṣu sutāsu ca // sapiṇḍāpatyadāreṣu prāṇatyāgo vidhīyate /
column2: It is laid down that one should end his life for having cohabited girls, caṇḍāla women, daughters and wives of one’s sapiṇḍa.

column1: yat karotyekarātreṇa vṛṣalīsevanaṃ dvijaḥ // tadbhaikṣyabhug japannityaṃ tribhirvarṣair vyapohati /
column2: The sin which a brahmin commits in a night by cohabiting a women of the lowest caste is got removed by him in three years by eating the food got after seeking alms and daily repetition of sacred syllables.

column1: pitṛvyadāragamane bhrātṛbhāryāgame tathā // cāṇḍālīṃ pukkasīṃ vāpi snuṣāñca bhaginīṃ sakhīṃ / mātuḥ pituḥ svasārañca nikṣiptāṃ śaraṇāgatāṃ // mātulānīṃ svasārañca sagotrāmanyamicchatīṃ / śiṣyabhāryāṃ gurorbhāryāṃ gatvā cāndrāyaṇañcaret //
column2: One has to practise cāndrāyaṇa for having cohabited the wife of the paternal uncle, wife of one’s brother, woman of the lowest caste, a woman of the pukkasa caste, one’s daughterinlaw, sister, friend, sisters of the mother and father, a woman who has been entrusted to one’s care, a woman who has sought refuge, wife of maternal uncle, one’s sister, a woman belonging to the same clan, a woman who desires another person, the wife of one’s pupil and the wife of one’s teacher.

column1: devāśramārcanādīnāṃ prāyaścittantu lopataḥ /
column2: shall describe the expiation for omission in the worship of gods and orders.

column1: pūjālope cāṣṭaśataṃ japeddviguṇapūjanaṃ //
column2: One should repeat one hundred and eight times and worship twice for omission in worship.

column1: pañcopaniṣadair mantrair hutvā brāhmaṇabhojanaṃ /
column2: After having made oblations with the five upaniṣadic sacred syllables brahmins should be fed.

column1: sūtikāntyajakodakyāspṛṣṭe deve śataṃ japet //
column2: One should repeat hundred times if the idol of the deity has been touched by a woman who has delivered a child, a woman of the lowest caste and a woman in her courses.

column1: pañcopaniṣadaiḥ pūjāṃ dviguṇaṃ snānameva ca /
column2: One should do worship with the five upaniṣadic sacred syllables and two times bathing.

column1: viprabhojyaṃ homalope homasnānaṃ tathārcanaṃ //
column2: Then one should do oblation, bathing and worship.

column1: homadravye mūṣikādyair bhakṣite kīṭasaṃyute / tāvanmātraṃ parityajya prokṣya devādi pūjayet //
column2: When the materials for the oblation have been eaten by rats, etc., or abound with worms, that part alone should be rejected, sprinkled with water and the deities worshipped.

column1: aṅkurārpaṇamātrantu chinnaṃ bhinnaṃ parityajet /
column2: When it is broken or damaged to the extent of a sprout it should be rejected.

column1: aspṛśyaiś caiva saṃspṛṣṭe anyapātre tadarpaṇaṃ //
column2: When it has been touched by an untouchable it should be transferred to another vessel.

column1: devamānuṣavighnaghnaṃ pūjākāle tathaiva ca / mantradravyādivyatyāse mūlaṃ japtvā punarjapet //
column2: If the sacred syllable or the materials get altered at the time of worship or in destroying the impediments due to the gods and mortals one should mutter the basic syllable and repeat again.

column1: bhinne naṣṭe copavāsaḥ śatahomācchubhaṃ bhavet // kṛte pāpe 'nutāpo vai yasya puṃsaḥ prajāyate /
column2: One should repeat one hundred times if the pot is lost. If the image of the deity has fallen from the hand and got broken or lost there will be welfare only after fasting and doing oblations hundred times.

column1: prāyaścittantu tasyaikaṃ harisaṃsmaraṇaṃ paraṃ //
column2: For a man who repents after doing a sin, the best expiation is to remember lord Hari.

column1: cāndrāyaṇaṃ parāko vā prājāpatyamaghaughanut /
column2: The practice of cāndrāyaṇa or parāka or prājāpatya destroys the sin.

column1: sūryeśaśaktiśrīśadimantrajapyamaghaughanut //
column2: The repetition of the sacred syllables of the Sun, Īśa lord Śiva, Śakti consort of lord Śiva, Śrīśa lord Viṣṇu and others would destroy the sin.

column1: gāyatrīpraṇavastotramantrajapyamaghāntakaṃ /
column2: The repetition of gāyatrī, praṇava oṃ, hymns and sacred syllables destroy sins.

column1: kādyair āvījasaṃyuktair ādyair ādyaistadantakaiḥ // sūryeśaśaktiśrīśādimantrāḥ koṭyadhikāḥ pṛthak /
column2: The sacred syllables of the Sun, Īśa, Śakti and Śrīśa beginning with the letters ‘ka’ etc. and their basic syllables and ending with the respective letters are separately more than a crore. The sacred syllables such as oṃ, hrīṃ etc.

column1: oṃhrīmādyāś caturthyantā namontāḥ sarvakāmadāḥ //
column2: and ending with the name in the fourth case and the word ‘salutation’ are capable of yielding all desires.

column1: nṛsiṃhadvādaśāṣṭārṇamālāmantrādyaghaughanut /
column2: The sacred syllables of lord Nṛsiṃha manlion form of lord Viṣṇu consisting of twelve and eight letters etc.

column1: āgneyasya purāṇasya paṭhanaṃ śravaṇādikaṃ //
column2: The reading and hearing etc. of Āgneyapurāṇa would also be expiation to remove all sins.

column1: dvividyārūpako viṣṇuragnirūpastu gīyate /
column2: Lord Viṣṇu is of two forms of Vidyā. He is praised in the form of fire.

column1: paramātmā devamukhaṃ sarvavedeṣu gīyate //
column2: The supreme lord is praised in all scriptures as the face of the celestials.

column1: pravṛttau tu nivṛttau tu ijyate bhuktimuktidaḥ /
column2: He is worshipped as the conferer of enjoyment and emancipation in taking active part in worldly life as well as in inactivity.

column1: agnirūpasya viṣṇorhi havanaṃ dhyānamarcanaṃ // japyaṃ stutiś ca praṇatiḥ śārīrāśeṣāghaughanut /
column2: The oblations, contemplation, worship, repetition of sacred syllables, hymns and obeisance made to lord Viṣṇu of the form of Fire god would destroy sins relating to one’s body.

column1: daśasvarṇāni dānāni dhānyadvādaśameva ca // tulāpuruṣamukhyāni mahādānāni ṣoḍaśa / annadānāni mukhyāni sarvāṇyaghaharāṇi hi //
column2: Making a gift of ten gold things, twelve kinds of grains, sixteen great gifts such as making a gift of something equal to one’s own weight and other great gifts such as giving food remove all sins.

column1: tithivārarkṣasaṅkrāntiyogamanvādikālake / bratādi sūryeśaśaktiśrīśāderaghaghātanaṃ //
column2: Practising vows on the phases of the moon, weeks, asterisms, movement of planets from one constellation to another, good periods of the day and period of Manu for the Sun, Īśa, Śakti and others would destroy sins.

column1: gaṅgā gayā prayāgaś ca kāśyayodhyā hy avamtikā / kurukṣetraṃ puṣkarañca naimiṣaṃ puruṣottamaḥ //
column2: The sacred places such as Ganges, Gayā, Prayāga, Kāśī, Ayodhyā, Avantikā, Kurukṣetra, Puṣkara, Naimiṣa, Puruṣottama Purī, Śālagrāma, Prabhāsa and others also destroy sins.

column1: ahaṃ brahma paraṃ jyotiriti dhyānamaghaughanut //
column2: The contemplation that ‘ am the brahman, the supreme effulgence’ would destroy sins..

column1: purāṇaṃ brahma cāgneyaṃ brahmā viṣṇurmaheśvaraḥ / avatārāḥ sarvapūjāḥ pratiṣṭhāpratimādikaṃ //
column2: The Brahmapurāṇa and the Āgneyapurāṇa, lords Brahmā, Viṣṇu, Maheśvara, the manifestations of the god, all kinds of worship, the installation of the images of deities etc.

column1: arthaśāstrañca sargādyā āyurvedo dhanurmatiḥ // śikṣā chando vyākaraṇaṃ niruktañcābhidhānakaṃ / kalpo nyāyaś ca mīmāṃsā hy anyat sarvaṃ hariḥ prabhuḥ //
column2: The science of astrology, Purāṇas, codes of law, penance, vow, the science of politics, sarga etc., the medical lore, the science of archery, phonetics, metrics, grammar, etymology, lexicon, manual of rituals, logic, mīmāṃsā the science investigating the vedic texts and all other things are the lord Hari himself.

column1: eke dvayoryato yasmin yaḥ sarvamiti veda yaḥ / taṃ dṛṣṭvānyasya pāpāni vinaśyanti hariś ca saḥ //
column2: The sins of others get destroyed by seeing one who has got the knowledge about the single lord without the second from which all are produced and in which all repose and who is everything.

column1: vidyāṣṭādaśarūpaś ca sūkṣmaḥ sthūlo 'paro hariḥ /
column2: He is verily the lord Hari. Lord Hari remains in the form of eighteen vidyās. He is subtle and gross.

column1: jyotiḥ sadakṣaraṃ brahma paraṃ viṣṇuś ca nirmalaḥ //
column2: He is the effulgence and the sentient, immutable, brahman, supreme, omnipresent and blemishless.

column1: tithivārarkṣadivasamāsartvabdārkasaṅkrame / nṛstrīvratādi vakṣyāmi vasiṣṭha śṛṇu tat kramāt //
column2: Listen O Vasiṣṭha! shall describe the vows for men and women to be observed in order on the phases of the moon, weeks, asterisms, particular day of a week, month, season, year and the entry of the Sun from one constellation into another.

column1: śāstrodito hi niyamo vrataṃ tacca tapo mataṃ /
column2: The vrata vow is a restraint as told in the scriptures. It is known to be a penance.

column1: niyamāstu viśeṣāstu vratasyaiva damādayaḥ //
column2: The special observances of dama subduing etc. are for the vow.

column1: vrataṃ hi kartṛsantāpāttapa ity abhidhīyate / indriyagrāmaniyamānniyamaścābhidhīyate //
column2: A vow is designated as a penance because it causes mortification of the body for the doer. It is said to be a restraint as it controls the collection of senses.

column1: anagnayastu ye viprāsteṣāṃ śreyo 'bhidhīyate / vratopavāsaniyamair nānādānais tathā dvijaḥ //
column2: O brahmin! Those brahmins who do not worship fire get prosperity by vows, fasting, restraints and many kinds of gifts. The gods etc.

column1: te syurdevādayaḥ prītā bhuktimuktipradāyakāḥ /
column2: who confer enjoyment and emancipation become pleased.

column1: upāvṛttasya pāpebhyo yastu vāso guṇaiḥ saha //
column2: One who has turned back from sins and lives with qualities it is known as upavāsa fasting.

column1: upavāsaḥ sa vijñeyaḥ sarvabhogavivarjitaḥ /
column2: It is devoid of all enjoyments.

column1: kāṃsyaṃ māṃsaṃ masūrañca caṇakaṃ koradūṣakaṃ // śākaṃ madhu parānnañca tyajedupavasan striyaṃ / puṣpālaṅkāravastrāṇi dhūpagandhanulepanaṃ //
column2: One who is fasting should reject bellmetal, flesh, masūra a kind of pulse, chickpea, koradūṣaka a species of grain, vegetable, wine, food from others, association with a woman, flowers, ornaments and dress, incense, perfume and unguent.

column1: upavāse na śasyanti dantadhāvanamañjanaṃ /
column2: People do not commend the cleaning of teeth and use of collyrium.

column1: dantakāṣṭhaṃ pañcagavyaṃ kṛtvā prātarvratañcaret //
column2: The five things got from a cow should be used in the place of the toothstick in the morning and the vow commenced.

column1: asakṛjjalapānācca tāmbūlasya ca bhakṣaṇāt / upavāsaḥ praduṣyeta divāsvapnācca maithunāt //
column2: Fasting gets vitiated by frequent drinking of water, the chewing of betels, dreaming and having intercourse during the day.

column1: kṣamā satyandayā dānaṃ śaucamindriyanigrahaḥ / devapūjāgniharaṇaṃ santoṣo 'steyameva ca // sarvavrateṣvayaṃ dharmaḥ sāmānyo daśadhā smṛtaḥ /
column2: Forbearance, truth, compassion, charity, cleanliness, control of the senses, worship of gods, making oblation to fire, happiness and not stealing are remembered to be the ten general virtues to be practised in all vows.

column1: pavitrāṇi japeccaiva juhuyāccaiva śaktitaḥ //
column2: Befitting one’s capacity one should repeat the sacred hymns and offer oblations to fire.

column1: nityasnāyī mitāhāro gurudevadvijārcakaḥ /
column2: One should bathe daily, eat moderately and worship preceptors, gods and brahmins.

column1: kṣāraṃ kṣaudrañca lavaṇaṃ madhu māṃsāni varjayet //
column2: One should avoid taking alkaline substances, honey, salt, wine and meat.

column1: tilamudgādṛte śasyaṃ śasye godhūmakodravau / cīnakaṃ devadhānyañca śamīdhānyaṃ tathaikṣavaṃ // śitadhānyaṃ tathā puṇyaṃ mūlaṃ kṣāragaṇaḥ smṛtaḥ /
column2: Among the grains all the grains except sesamum and mudga a kind of kidneybean are commendable. Wheat, kodrava a species of grain, cīnaka a kind of paddy, devadhānya, leguminous grain, sugar, śitadhānya barley or white paddy?, roots from the market are deemed to be alkaline things.

column1: vrīhiṣaṣṭikamudgāś ca kalāyāḥ satilā yavāḥ // śyāmākāś caiva nīvārā godhūmādyā vrate hitāḥ /
column2: Rice, ṣaṣṭika a kind of rice, mudga a kind of kidney bean, sesamum, barley, śyāmāka a kind of corn, rice grown without cultivation and wheat etc. are conducive to vows.

column1: kuṣmāṇḍālāvuvārtākūn pālaṅkīmpūtikāntyajet //
column2: One should avoid taking pumpkin, bottlegourd, brinjal, uālaṅkī ? and pūtikā a kind of herb.

column1: carubhaikṣyaṃ śaktukaṇāḥ śākandadhi ghṛtaṃ payaḥ / śyāmākaśālinīvārā yavakaṃ mūlataṇḍulaṃ // haviṣyaṃ vratanaktādāvagnikāryādike hitaṃ / madhu māṃsaṃ vihāyānyad vrate vā hitamīritaṃ //
column2: Sweet porridge, the flour of barley, pāṭāherb, curd, ghee, milk, śyāmāka a kind of corn, rice, rice growing without cultivation, mūlataṇḍula are conducive as haviṣya fit to be offered as oblation at the time of vows in general and nakta vrata eating food only in the night in the rites of offering made to fire. Except wine and meat, the other things are said to be conferring good in a vow.

column1: tryahaṃ prātastryahaṃ sāyaṃ tryahamadyādayācitaṃ / tryahamparañca nāśnīyāt prājāpatyañcaran dvijaḥ //
column2: A brahmin who observes the prājāpatya should eat in the morning for three days, in the evening for three days, without seeking alms for three days, and should not eat the next three days.

column1: ekaikaṃ grāsamaśnīyāt tryahāṇi trīṇi pūrvavat / tryahañcopavasedantyamatikṛcchraṃ caran dvijaḥ //
column2: A brahmin who is practising the atikṛcchra should eat one morsel a day for three days three times as before and fast for three days at the end.

column1: gomūtraṃ gomayaṃ kṣīraṃ dadhi sarpiḥ kuśodakaṃ / ekarātropavāsaś ca kṛcchraṃ śāntapanaṃ smṛtaṃ //
column2: The expiation sāntapana is known to be that of taking cow’s urine, cowdung, milk, curd, clarified butter and water with the kuśa and fasting for a night.

column1: pṛthak śāntapanadravyaiḥ ṣaḍahaḥ sopavāsakaḥ / saptāhena tu kṛcchro 'yaṃ mahāśāntapano 'ghahā //
column2: Maintaining with the six materials used in the sāntapana, each one for a day for six days together with fasting in seven days is known to be mahāsāntapana, which removes the sin.

column1: dvādaśāhopavāsena parākaḥ sarvapāpahā /
column2: Parāka is fasting for twelve days and it destroys all sins.

column1: mahāparākastriguṇastvayameva prakīrtitaḥ //
column2: If it is threefold of above it is said to be mahāparāka.

column1: paurṇamāsyāṃ pañcadaśagrāsyamāvāsyabhojanaḥ / ekāpāye tato vṛddhau cāndrāyaṇamato 'nyathā //
column2: Commencing with fifteen morsels of food on fullmoon day, reducing one morsel a day and no food on newmoon day and then increasing a morsel a day is known to be cāndrāyaṇa.

column1: kapilāgoḥ palaṃ mūtraṃ ardhāṅguṣṭhañca gomayaṃ / kṣīraṃ saptapalandadyāt dadhnaś caiva paladvayaṃ // ghṛtamekapalandadyāt palamekaṃ kuśodakaṃ /
column2: Or one pala a measure of weight of urine of a tawny cow, cowdung of half the volume of a thumb, seven palas of milk, two palas of curd, ghee one pala, one pala of water in which kuśa has been dipped should be collected.

column1: gayatryā gṛhya gomūtraṃ gandhadvāreti gomayaṃ // āpyāyasveti ca kṣīraṃ dadhikrāvṇeti vai dadhi / tejo 'sīti tathā cājyaṃ devasyeti kuśodakaṃ //
column2: Among these, urine of cow should be gathered with the syllable gāyatrī, cowdung with gandhadvāra, milk with āpyāyasva, curd with dadhikrāvṇa clarified butter with tejo asi, and water in which kuśa has been dipped with devasya.

column1: brahmakūrco bhavatyevaṃ āpo hiṣṭhetyṛcaṃ japet /
column2: It is brahmakūrca by doing as above. Then one should repeat the hymn āpo hi ṣṭhā.

column1: aghamarṣaṇasūktena saṃyojya praṇavena vā //
column2: They all should be mixed with the repetition of the hymn aghamarṣaṇa or the praṇava syllable oṃ.

column1: pītvā sarvāghanirmukto viṣṇulokī hy upoṣitaḥ /
column2: After drinking the mixture one gets free from all sins and reaches the world of Viṣṇu after fasting.

column1: upavāsī sāyambhojī yatiḥ ṣaṣṭhātmakālavān // māṃsavarjī cāśvamedhī satyavādī divaṃ vrajet /
column2: A person who fasts, eats only in the evening, an ascetic, and one who eats only in the sixth part of the day, avoids eating meat, performs the aśvamedha sacrifice and speaks truth would reach heaven.

column1: agnyādheyaṃ pratiṣṭhāñca yajñadānavratāni ca // devavratavṛṣotsargacūḍākaraṇamekhalāḥ / māṅgalyamabhiṣekañca malamāse vivarjayet //
column2: The maintenance of sacred fire, the installation of images of deities, the performance of sacrifices, making gifts and practice of vows, observance of religious vow, the rite of letting out a bull, tonsure, the investiture with the girdle and the auspicious bathing should be avoided in the malamāsa a solar month in which two new moons occur.

column1: darśāddarśastu cāndraḥ syāt triṃśāhaś caiva bhāvanaḥ /
column2: The lunar month would be from the new moon to the new moon. The sāvana month would be of thirty days.

column1: māsaḥ saurastu saṅkrānternākṣatro bhavivartanāt //
column2: The solar month would be reckoned from the movement of the sun from one constellation to another.

column1: sauro māso vivāhādau yajñādau sāvanaḥ smṛtaḥ / āvdhike pitṛkārye ca cāndro māsaḥ praśasyate //
column2: Solar month should be taken for the marriage etc., and sāvana for sacrifices etc. Lunar month is recommended for the annual ceremony and ancestral rites.

column1: āṣāḍhīmavadhiṃ kṛtvā yaḥ syātpakṣastu pañcamaḥ /
column2: The fifth one would be that which concludes with themonth of āṣāḍha JulyAugust.

column1: kuryācchrāddhantatra raviḥ kanyāṃ gacchatu vā na vā //
column2: One may perform the ceremony for the ancestors at that time whether the Sun moves into the constellation Virgo or not.

column1: māsi saṃvatsare caiva tithidvaidhaṃ yadā bhavet / tatrottarottamā jñeyā pūrvā tu syān malimlucā //
column2: Whenever a lunar day occurs twice in a month in a year, there the second one is known to be the excellent one and the first one would be bad.

column1: upoṣitavyaṃ nakṣatraṃ yenāstaṃ yāti bhāskaraḥ /
column2: One should fast in an asterism when the Sun sets in that.
